title: Business Analyst
description: Our client is an innovative AdTech company that delivers advanced solutions for global businesses. They leverage cutting-edge technological advancements to provide custom programmatic products, digital transformation services, and expert consultations. They highly skilled professionals comprehensively understand AdTech trends and emerging technologies. This expertise empowers them to deliver programmatic solutions that optimize their clients’ efficiency, productivity, and growth. They address various programmatic needs, from developing bespoke platforms and implementing AdTech solutions to optimizing existing programmatic infrastructure. The company prioritizes building strong partnerships with our clients. They take a collaborative approach, working closely to understand their unique requirements and objectives. This synergy of technical excellence and a client-centric focus ensures that the solutions meet and surpass expectations, delivering measurable results and propelling business success. The company is currently seeking a talented Business Analyst to join the growing team. You’ll have the opportunity to: — Leverage your skills and knowledge in a dynamic and growing industry — Collaborate with a talented team of professionals — Play a key role in shaping the future of ad techIf you’re ready to take your career to the next level, we encourage you to apply! Requirements: — Experience as a Business Analyst. — Knowledge of the AdTech/Programmatic/OpenRTB, including advertising platforms, supply platforms, and ad exchanges (Will be a plus). — Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze complex data sets, extract insights, and make data-driven recommendations. — Experience in creating and maintaining tech/feature/product documentation. — Understanding of gathering the requirements to design detailed feature descriptions for tech team implementation. — Proactive attitude towards learning and staying updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in business analytics and ad tech. — Willingness to work on product development and improvements. — English: Upper-Intermediate and above, both verbal and written. — Good knowledge of Atlassian instruments (Jira, Confluence) is a must. Responsibilities: — Collaborate with clients to gather and prioritize new features and enhancement requirements. — Translate business needs into clear and actionable product requirements. Create and describe features from scratch and work with existing feature improvements/change requests. — Conduct in-depth product research on industry trends, competitor analysis, and emerging technologies within the ad tech domain. Share the vision. — Assist in developing product roadmaps and strategic plans based on market research, customer feedback, and business objectives. Participate in customized features upsell to customers based on their product needs. — Develop comprehensive documentation, including product specifications, user guides, and technical documentation. Benefits: — Flexible work setup: Choose between fully remote, hybrid, or office-based in Kyiv, Odesa, or Mykolaiv with refreshments/snacks and dedicated spaces for relaxation and leisure activities; — Professional growth: Join a strong team, access courses and conferences, and utilize our electronic library for continuous learning; — Performance-based annual salary reviews: Fair and competitive compensation tied to your work performance; — Work-life balance: Enjoy 22 paid vacation days per year; — Well-being support: Comprehensive medical insurance, paid sick leaves, and access to a corporate psychologist; — Vibrant corporate culture: Offsite parties, celebrations, team-building activities, sporting events, and corporate gifts/bonuses.

company: Amick Brown - SAP, Cloud Technologies and Business Intelligence Staffing & Consulting
title: Senior Business Analyst
description: Amick Brown is seeking an experienced Senior Business Analyst - SAP Warehouse Management (SAP S4 WM/ EWM) for our direct client. Location: Sunnyvale, CA Duration: 12 months Estimated pay range: $80 - 100 per hour per client contract and candidate skills, experience and work location. Roles & Responsibilities Drive business blue printing workshops with business and other cross functional teams. As-Is To-Be discussions and mapping of business process flows. Gather requirements from Warehouse & Shipping department, analyze and provide solutions based on best industrial practices Configure, Develop and test changes in SAP for all requirements. Responsible for the overall design & solutioning for SAP WM / SAP S/4 HANA EWM and integration with other modules. Working as single point of contact for configurations, development, data migration in WM and EWM modules. Should be able to work with cross functional modules including Material Management, Quality Management, Production Planning and Sales & Distribution. Document and train other teams for newly implemented processes Ability to quickly adapt to changes in timelines and sequences. Develop and execute test plans for SAP WM and EWM configurations. Required Skills 10 plus years of experience in SAP At least 2 end to end project implementations with hands on configuration experience in SAP WM module. At least 2 end to end project implementations with hands on configuration experience in SAP EWM module. At least 1 end to end project implementation where SAP is interfaced with External WMS system. 3PL integration experience is required to build interfaces between SAP and WMS systems via Idocs and API’s Good knowledge in ALE/EDI/IDOC field mapping for data transmission from SAP to External WMS systems. Should have worked in a high volume distribution centers handling diversified products ( Batch and Serialized Candidate is expected to have expertise on Cartonization, Quality Inspection Engine, Quantity classifications & Warehouse order optimization rules. Possess solid knowledge in SAP EWM Mater Data integrations, Inbound, Outbound, Internal Movements, Cycle counting and Kitting Experience integrating with shop floor orders and kitting orders Strong knowledge in the following areas of WM and EWM Warehouse master data, org structure setup in WM and EWM. Complex Storage Types, put away and Stock removal strategies through configuration or using BADI as applicable in EWM Strong knowledge in Inbound process and Put-way process in WM and EWM covering Palletization, consolidation, deconsolidation using Handling Unit. Strong knowledge in Outbound shipments & Stock removal process in WM and EWM. Exposure and working experience with Handling Unit Management for Inbound, Internal Movements and Outbound processes. Warehouse internal processes, Posting change notice and Production order staging in WM Kanban material replenishment in WM Replenishment with in Warehouse & Replenishment between Warehouses in WM Internal Warehouse processes such as Replenishment, Cycle counting, Physical Inventory and Warehouse re organization in EWM. Hands on in Cross process settings, exception handling using custom solutions where applicable in EWM Through working experience with Post Processing Framework for standard and custom definitions Project stock management in WM Customizing WM movement types in WM Wave Management including Wave templates in EWM. Batch Management, Serial Management, Handling Unit Management/ SU management in SAP WM Cycle counting process and interface with external WMS for cycle counting Understanding of ITS mobile and RF devices with RF configuration & Queue management Outputs, Label printing, Scanners ( RFID, 2D & Linear ) Involved in development of WM reports and Warehouse activity monitor Exposure to Slotting and Warehouse Re organization Integration knowledge of LE, WM, MM with SD, PP, QM, FI, CO modules Working experience in LSMW, Batch job monitoring/ creation and Idoc Monitoring Good Understanding about ABAP Development, Debugging, custom objects such as BADI, functional modules, ALV Reports etc. Should closely work with security teams for roles and authorization. Daily Queue Management and resolution in both ECC and EWM systems. Experienced in documenting Functional design specifications for custom developments. Preferred to have TMS Integration knowledge. Amick Brown is an Information Technology consulting company specializing in ERP, Data Analytics, Information Security, Application Development, Networking, and Cloud Computing. The company was founded in 2010 and is headquartered in San Ramon, California. Regular full-time employees are eligible for the following Amick Brown provided benefits: Health Vision Dental 401k with company match Paid time off. Sick Leave Long -Term Disability Life Insurance Wellness & Discount Programs

title: Senior Business Analyst
description: *** Notes: Project starts on July 2nd / Sponsorship not provided *** Project Description: Luxoft is looking for a Business / Financial Analyst(s) who would be working with our Customer - one of the world's largest investment management companies. Based in Southern California, our client manages close to $2 trillion in assets and is working with Luxoft in a full-scale upgrade of their technology. We are looking for talented and ambitious people to work on the engagement in Luxoft ODC office in Krakow. It's a high potential engagement with opportunity to expand our reach into a large share of their new and existing business. Responsibilities: • Discuss, understand and document project stakeholder business requirements to direct software and business process development. • Write business requirement documents. • Collaborate with the development team to design and present the proposition to the stakeholders/users. • Work with the team during the development phase to ensure business requirements are met and that requirements and specification documents are kept up to date. • Proactively manage changes to requirements to ensure all parties have a full understanding of the required changes and the system/process/project implications. • Work with the development team to test the software and business processes developed to ensure they satisfy the business requirements, and meet the design/specification. Mandatory Skills Description: • Advanced spoken and written English. • Good team communication skills, confident in dealing with project stakeholders. • Highly developed written and oral communication skills • Superior analytical thinking. • Excellent organizational, administration and time management skills. • Familiarity with financial markets, trading and investment management. • Understanding of testing methodology. • Good understanding of Agile SDLC's. • Be quick learner and have a desire to learn the domain and its business processes.

title: Business Analyst
description: Job Description Minimum Techincal Qualifications: At least seven (7) years of experience within the last ten (10) years working as a Business Analyst with large organizations, leading or participating in the technical implementation of software/systems/applications automating complex business processes, performing all the following activities: Assessment of analysis scope and tasks Planning business analysis tasks Facilitating joint application design (JAD) and/or collaborative design sessions Elicitation, definitions and documentation of various business, user, and system requirements Analysis for business process improvement, application design and workflow automation Modeling and documenting functional designs Leading and working within cross-functional teams that include business subject matter experts, application architects, developers, and testers At least seven (7) years of experience within the last ten (10) years producing business analysis deliverables such as any of the following: (CalSTRS may request deliverable related work samples during Phase 4, Interviews, of the Comparison Process): Business requirements and business rules Functional requirements and/or functional specifications Non-functional requirements Stakeholder requests Procurement documentation Transition plans and/or implementation requirements Traceability matrices At least three (3) years of experience using Rational Requisite Pro, HP ALM, Jama, or other requirement gathering tool to document functional and non-functional requirements, design specifications and provide full traceability for projects. Desirable Qualifications Experience as a Business Analyst with the State or Federal government. Experience as a Business Analyst leading or participating in the technical implementation of pension/retirement-related software development projects – especially Business Intelligence and Data Warehouse solutions including the following areas of focus: Pension administration and financial related data: annual or final compensation, service credit, contributions, interest, payables, receivables, various benefit factor types, benefit formula calculations, payroll deductions, school district reported salary data on behalf of members, Medicare data, etc. Investments related data: portfolio performance and management, investment exposure, private and real estate asset classes, risk exposure, rate of return, net asset value, benchmark, Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG), Sustainable Investments and Stewardship Strategies data. Service Level Goals and Objective related data and pension administration related audit data. A wide variety of dashboarding, forecasting, and modeling including existing predefined reports for various business areas. IIBA Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP or CCBA). CalSTRS may request a copy of Certification. Experience in agile methodology or Scaled Agile Framework. Experience acting as a project manager for software development or implementation projects. Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Management Information Systems, or related fields from an accredited or government-sanctioned college/university. CalSTRS may request a copy of degree.

title: Business Analyst / Consultant
description: Role: Business Analyst / Consultant Location: Mountain View, CA (Remote) Hire Type: Contract Responsibilities Collaborate closely with business stakeholders, including underwriters, actuaries, and line of business managers, to understand their challenges, objectives, and key performance indicators (KPIs) related to healthcare insurance lines of business. Gather and document detailed business requirements, processes, and workflows to inform data science projects and initiatives. Work with data engineers and data scientists to identify relevant data sources, define data requirements, and ensure data quality and completeness. Assist in the development of data models, machine learning models, and analytical solutions to address business problems and support decision-making processes. Interpret and communicate complex data analysis and modeling results to non-technical stakeholders, highlighting key insights and recommendations. Facilitate the implementation of data-driven solutions and ensure their successful adoption within the business units. Continuously monitor and evaluate the performance and impact of implemented solutions, providing feedback for improvement and further optimization. Stay up-to-date with industry trends, regulations, and best practices related to healthcare insurance and data science applications. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including IT, legal, and compliance, to ensure adherence to relevant policies and regulatory requirements. Requirements Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Economics, Healthcare Administration, or a related field. 3+ years of experience as a Business Analyst or a similar role in the healthcare insurance industry. Strong understanding of healthcare insurance operations, products, and processes, including underwriting, claims management, and risk assessment. Experience working with data science teams and familiarity with data analysis, modeling, and machine learning concepts. Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and ability to effectively communicate complex data insights. Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with technical and non-technical teams. Attention to detail and commitment to delivering high-quality solutions. Preferred Qualifications Knowledge of data engineering and data governance practices. Familiarity with agile development methodologies and project management frameworks. Understanding of healthcare regulations, compliance, and data privacy requirements (e.g., HIPAA). Relevant certifications in healthcare, business analysis, or data science domains

title: Senior Business Analyst
description: MeUndies is a Los Angeles, CA-based underwear and loungewear company best known for its softer-than-soft basics. Founded in 2011, MeUndies disrupted the $110B underwear industry with the first online underwear subscription. Since then, the brand has inspired a passionate community of undie-obsessed individuals with its bold, comfortable products. And that’s only the beginning… Today MeUndies has sold more than thirty million pairs of underwear and is profitable with double-digit YoY growth. It continues to redefine the subscription market by evolving the transactional subscription to a membership centered on community and relationships with the brand. The innovative direct-to-consumer brand offers multiple purchasing options, including singles, packs, matching pairs, and monthly membership. With a growing company, comes a growing team full of innovative people. We are looking for a Senior Business Analyst to help build out our next-generation business analytics and finance program. You will be hands-on with both a variety of technologies as well as intimately involved with the creation and execution of our data-driven strategies, ranging from customer acquisition and retention, to product planning and merchandising. This role is a great opportunity to work in a highly visible role with a 360-degree view of a growing digitally-native, omnichannel brand. If you are someone who enjoys the intersection of data analytics and business or financial strategy, this role is a great fit for you! The Senior Business Analyst will report directly to the Director of Data, Analytics & Finance. Please note that this is a hybrid position of 4 days/week in our Los Angeles office What You'll Do Dashboard and report creation within Tableau for various departments around the business (ranging from web analytics, marketing, product planning and merchandising, logistics, etc). Monitoring of key e-commerce and subscription program metrics, as well as identification of emerging trends and underlying drivers Ability to carry projects from issue identification, scoping of solutions, distilling recommendations, through to cross-functional execution and monitoring. Overall project management - maintaining a roadmap and ability to communicate roadblocks and changes to priorities effectively Stakeholder management - Ability to work cross-functionally with varying levels of stakeholders (executives, engineering counterparts, and operational department leads) Identification and documentation of business requirements of stakeholders, and assessment of if requirements have been ultimately met when projects conclude Data Insights - Broad knowledge and understanding of business and financial impact based on information contained in our data. This individual will also be summarizing insights in various deliverable formats, depending on the specific need (dashboards, slide decks, one-pagers, etc) Develop and maintain web and marketing analytics such as: customer lifecycle marketing, customer lifetime value, customer segmentation, marketing channel attribution and performance, funnel analysis, A/B testing and promotional analysis Basic modeling and forecast creation What You Have 2-5 years relevant experience; ideal candidates will have e-commerce experience and/or financial/business analysis experience Degree in Business Administration, Finance/Accounting, Data Analytics, Data Science, etc SQL Experience Required Intermediate to Advanced Excel Skills Required Familiarity and experience with BI Tools (such as Tableau, Looker, Looker Studio, PowerBI, etc.), and a track record of creating polished and professional reports Experience performing financial modeling, forecasting, budgeting, variance analysis or other related financial analysis experience is preferred Experience with conducting analyses and distilling insights for varying audiences (engineering partners, executive leadership, operational stakeholders, etc.) A passion for data integrity - you let the numbers define the narrative rather than finding numbers to support a narrative Project management experience is ideal (roadmap management and development, working and executing against project plans, communicating effectively when deviations from the plan are identified, etc) Ability to manage time effectively - Understand how to manage competing priorities, communicate effectively upward when priorities need to shift, and identify when additional assistance is needed to remain effective and execute to plan Checking off some but not all the boxes?! NO worries, we would still love to hear from you! The base salary range for this full-time position is $95,000 - $128,000. Within this range, individual pay is determined by various factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Please note that the base salary range provided in this posting does not include any bonus, equity, or benefits you may be eligible for. WHY WORK AT MEUNDIES? It's more than a job. We have focused on building a team of people who emulate our core values. We look for people who stay balanced, go further, build relationships, champion differences, and are humble. At MeUndies, we continue to maintain a stellar brand by working collaboratively and encouraging growth with learning opportunities. There is no such thing as a small achievement here - we celebrate it all! We look at the necessities. We offer competitive equity/salary packages, including targeted annual bonuses, generous parental leave, a 401k, fantastic health benefits, open time off, and more. We have an office you’ll enjoy going to. We currently have a hybrid work schedule where Fridays are optional work-from-home days, and Mondays, Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays are in-office days. Although Friday is a remote/work-from-home day, the office is open, and you are welcome to come in! We’re set up to support comfortable working - hot desks, lounge, and casual seating areas, a Mother’s Room, an on-site gym & shower, and a kitchen that makes you feel like you’ve never left home. We’re dog-friendly, so your furry coworker can join you anytime. We don’t forget the most important things. We want MeUndies to be a place where you feel safe and comfortable, and we encourage our employees to hold us accountable for keeping it that way. We encourage open communication and a People Ops team that is ready to help. When you work at MeUndies, we take your needs as an employee (and a person) seriously. Our doors are always welcome to feedback and suggestions! Plus those special extra things. We also know how important it is to connect with your team members outside of everyday work. We offer catered lunches every in-office day, holiday parties, off-sites, happy hours, and an annual retreat. You’ll also get a sweet employee discount to rebuild your underwear drawer with our top-notch prints. MeUndies is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace and hiring process free from discrimination. All employment decisions will be made, and all qualified applicants will be considered, without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex (including gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity), ethnicity, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or other legally protected characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. In addition, MeUndies will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable federal, state and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.

Job Description Summary - The Business Systems Analyst III is a liaison between end-users/clients and the Information Technology department. The position is responsible for reviewing, analyzing, and evaluating the more complex business systems and user needs. Formulates systems to parallel overall business strategies; writes detailed description of user needs, program functions, and steps required to develop or modify computer programs. Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Interviews end-users/customers to define business requirements for complex software modifications and enhancements. Meets with external clients to discuss enhancement requests as needed. Translates business requirements by reviewing, analyzing and evaluating needs into functional specifications. Coordinates and responds to requests for changes from original specifications. Facilitates design sessions with the business and technical resources to ensure that the solutions meets the needs of the business. Consults with technical teams on design and database issues. Defines and documents requirements business rules to assist in the development of software specifications to include system requirements, flow charts, report mock-ups, and business rules Drives and/or leads projects to completion for assigned projects. Develops project plans, prioritize project tasks, and provides regular status updates on project progress to management and stakeholders. Develops business processes that ensure developed application meets all project requirements. Ensures that projects are completed on time, accurate to defined specifications and within budget. Performs quality control checks on software before it is released to the QA department. Provides support to software development and QA staff as needed. Handles, prioritizes and manages multiple Service Requests (SR's) throughout entire software development life cycle. Handles software release management of designated applications. May mentor and provide functional work direction to less experience Business Systems Analysts.

title: Business Analyst
description: J ob description We are seeking a Business Analyst with experience supporting utility companies. In this role, you will collaborate with clients to identify business needs, elicit requirements, and analyze data to drive informed decision-making. Your objective is to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of utility operations through insightful analysis and the implementation of data-driven solutions. Responsibilities of this position include but are not limited to: Requirements Elicitation and Problem Analysis: Work closely with utility clients to understand business objectives, processes, and challenges. Create Product roadmaps and feature backlog. Elicit, document, and analyze business requirements, ensuring a comprehensive understanding of client needs. Data Analysis and Interpretation: Conduct in-depth data analysis to derive actionable insights and inform strategic decision-making. Translate complex datasets into clear and concise findings, providing valuable recommendations for improvement. Process Improvement: Identify opportunities for business process improvement within utility IT systems and applications. Collaborate with stakeholders to streamline workflows, enhance efficiency, and optimize resource utilization. Technology Solution Evaluation: Evaluate and recommend technology solutions that align with business requirements and industry best practices. Collaborate with technical teams to ensure proposed solutions meet business needs. Change Management: Support the development and implementation of change management strategies for process improvements and technology implementations. Provide guidance on overcoming resistance and fostering a positive transition within organizations. Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate with business stakeholders, technology teams, and leadership to facilitate effective communication and understanding. Bridge the gap between business requirements and technical implementation. Documentation and Reporting: Create clear and concise documentation of business processes, requirements, and analysis findings. Generate reports and dashboards to communicate key performance indicators and project progress. Required Qualifications: Education: Bachelor's or master's degree in business administration, Information Technology, or a related field, or equivalent job-related experience. Knowledge, Skills & Experience: Proven experience as a business analyst or consultant specializing in the utility or energy distribution sector. Demonstrated success in gathering and analyzing business requirements. In-depth understanding of utility business processes, regulations, and industry-specific challenges. Familiarity with energy distribution systems, enterprise resource planning, customer relationship management, and smart grid technologies. Strong analytical and critical thinking skills, with the ability to translate business needs into practical technology solutions. Proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques. Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex concepts to diverse stakeholders. Effective people skills to build and maintain relationships with clients, business stakeholders, and technology teams. Basic project management skills or experience in coordinating project activities. Understanding of change management principles and experience in supporting process improvements. Proficient in creating clear and concise documentation of business processes, requirements, and analysis findings. Qualifications: Additional certifications or advanced degrees in Business Analysis, Data Analysis, or related fields a plus. Familiarity with data science concepts and tools to enhance analytical capabilities a plus. Familiarity with SAP, Oracle, or IBM ERP systems and how they are used at utilities a plus. Basic knowledge of technology solutions and their applications in the utility sector. Experience in collaborating with cross-functional teams, including business stakeholders, IT, and operations. Membership in relevant professional organizations or associations related to business analysis or the utility sector a plus. Experience in public speaking, presenting at conferences, or contributing to thought leadership in the utility sector a plus. Experience in managing relationships with technology vendors and evaluating third-party solutions. This is a hybrid role and would require you to be on-site at least monthly.

Data Analysis And Interpretation Conduct in-depth data analysis to derive actionable insights and inform strategic decision-making. Translate complex datasets into clear and concise findings, providing valuable recommendations for improvement. Process Improvement Identify opportunities for business process improvement within utility IT systems and applications. Collaborate with stakeholders to streamline workflows, enhance efficiency, and optimize resource utilization. Technology Solution Evaluation Evaluate and recommend technology solutions that align with business requirements and industry best practices. Collaborate with technical teams to ensure proposed solutions meet business needs. Change Management Support the development and implementation of change management strategies for process improvements and technology implementations. Provide guidance on overcoming resistance and fostering a positive transition within organizations. Stakeholder Engagement Collaborate with business stakeholders, technology teams, and leadership to facilitate effective communication and understanding. Bridge the gap between business requirements and technical implementation. Documentation And Reporting Create clear and concise documentation of business processes, requirements, and analysis findings. Generate reports and dashboards to communicate key performance indicators and project progress. Education Required Qualifications: Bachelor's or master's degree in business administration, Information Technology, or a related field, or equivalent job-related experience. Knowledge, Skills & Experience Proven experience as a business analyst or consultant specializing in the utility or energy distribution sector. Demonstrated success in gathering and analyzing business requirements. In-depth understanding of utility business processes, regulations, and industry-specific challenges. Familiarity with energy distribution systems, enterprise resource planning, customer relationship management, and smart grid technologies. Strong analytical and critical thinking skills, with the ability to translate business needs into practical technology solutions. Proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques. Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex concepts to diverse stakeholders. Effective people skills to build and maintain relationships with clients, business stakeholders, and technology teams. Basic project management skills or experience in coordinating project activities. Understanding of change management principles and experience in supporting process improvements. Proficient in creating clear and concise documentation of business processes, requirements, and analysis findings. Qualifications Additional certifications or advanced degrees in Business Analysis, Data Analysis, or related fields a plus. Familiarity with data science concepts and tools to enhance analytical capabilities a plus. Familiarity with SAP, Oracle, or IBM ERP systems and how they are used at utilities a plus. Basic knowledge of technology solutions and their applications in the utility sector. Experience in collaborating with cross-functional teams, including business stakeholders, IT, and operations. Membership in relevant professional organizations or associations related to business analysis or the utility sector a plus. Experience in public speaking, presenting at conferences, or contributing to thought leadership in the utility sector a plus. Experience in managing relationships with technology vendors and evaluating third-party solutions. This is a hybrid role and would require you to be on-site at least monthly.

title: Business Operations Analyst
description: Description Evolus is a performance beauty company with a customer-centric approach focused on delivering breakthrough products. We are seeking a Business Operations Analyst to join our commercial analytics team, supporting strategic, operational, and tactical initiatives that elevate our sales success and channel management. As a key member of Evolus’ Global Insights and Analytics team, you will function as a business partner to the Commercial organization, directly & indirectly supporting their efforts to drive growth and achieve success. This role requires proficiency on matters related to reporting, field operations, forecasting, and other productivity-related functions. If you are looking for an opportunity to showcase your abilities while growing your career, look no further! In this role, you will be challenged to fuel the success of our department and the larger organization. Let’s talk about some of the key responsibilities of the role: Own various facets of sales & business analytics and insights (including reporting, forecasting, dashboards, targeting, performance tracking, and contract management.) Lead the creation and implementation of processes and procedures to support Evolus’ sales channels. Identify opportunities to streamline and automate key sales processes to improve efficiency and reduce manual workload. Partner with sales leaders to improve & sustain contract adherence metrics and customer-facing reporting. Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs), optimizing sales & data processes, and other metrics and analyzes Partner with Finance, IT, HR, etc., to develop strategies and automation tools to support various Evolus cross functions & strategies. Collaborate with Marketing to align on current promotions and asset strategies that support business development. Ensure data integrity and accuracy, performing regular audits and validations. Drive innovation by exploring new tools, methodologies, and strategies to enhance effectiveness and operational efficiency. Other related duties may be assigned based on business needs. Skills and Qualifications Required for this Dynamic Team Member: Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. Minimum of 1-3 years of progressive experience in Sales Operations related roles. Management Consulting, Medical Device, Pharmaceutical, Biotech or CPG industry experience preferred. Advanced Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint skills required. Experience using SFDC, BI tools, Tableau, Data Warehouses is preferable. Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Able to work independently in a fast paced and dynamic environment. Highly analytical, detail oriented and strong business acumen. Proven track record of driving process improvements and implementing automation solutions. Strong intuition on field needs and ability to put yourself in the shoes of a sales leader or rep Able to think critically, identify gaps and develop a plan to address those issues. A Few Other Items Worth Mentioning: Office location – Newport Beach. Hybrid Tuesday – Thursday onsite.Monday + Friday remote optional. Position reports directly to our Senior Manager, Sales Operations & Sales Analytics Compensation & Total Rewards: The expected pay range for this position is $60,000 - $75,000 + annual bonus. Your actual base salary will be determined on a case-by-case basis and may vary based on a number of considerations including but not limited to role relevant knowledge and skills, experience, education, certifications, and more. We offer more than just a paycheck, and your base salary is just the start! Stay happy and healthy with our competitive suite of medical, dental and vision benefits to help you feel your best and be your best. We also provide those benefits you shouldn’t have to worry about, from employer covered life insurance to short-term disability. Take advantage of the 401k match offered by Evolus and let us invest in your future. You may also be eligible for new hire equity and long-term incentives in the form of RSUs, stock options, and/or discretionary bonuses. We offer mental health and wellbeing resources for you to develop skills to find your calm, boost your confidence, and show up as your best self in work and life. Travel or relax and come back feeling refreshed with our flexible paid time off program for exempt employees and a paid time off accrual plan for non-exempt employees. Did we mention the holiday soft closure between the Christmas and New Years holidays? We have that, too. Additional perks include regularly catered team meals at our Evolus Headquarters, a fully stocked kitchen (Kombucha & Coffee included), and the opportunity to join an organization where our values of Grit, Impact, Fun, and Transparency are displayed daily. Evolus takes pride in being a company on the forefront of innovation, while being committed to conducting its business with the highest degrees of integrity, professionalism, and social responsibility. We are also committed to complying with all laws and regulations that apply to our business. Employee welfare is no different. Here at Evolus, we don’t just work together, we’ve built a diverse culture of inclusion! Because of this, you’ll find yourself immersed in an environment that not only promotes respect, collaboration, and team building, but a community too. And that’s just the tip of the iceberg. Join our team and see for yourself! EOE M/F/D/V. For more information, please visit our website at www.evolus.com.

title: Business Operations Analyst
description: Who are we? IEQ Capital is a Registered Investment Advisor, seeking to transform traditional wealth management. Our quest is to integrate the Intellectual and Emotional Quotient, generating exceptional investment results driven by a values-oriented culture that fosters connection and collaboration with our clients. We are an independent, predominantly employee-owned company, adhering to the fiduciary standard to put our clients' interests first. We focus our efforts on helping clients meet their investment objectives without the distractions and limitations that can arise within much larger organizations. The Role IEQ Capital is looking for a motivated professional to join our Foster City-based team as a Business Operations Analyst. The Analyst will work cross-functionally to assess current operations, streamline existing workflows, and identify opportunities for automation. They will develop an in-depth knowledge of our tech stack and will collaborate with internal and external resources to execute on firmwide initiatives. Duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Drive high impact initiatives by leveraging technology and systems Ability to leverage business insights using data to communicate recommendations to key stakeholders Collaborate with the Operations and Client Service teams to improve efficiency across all platforms Become familiar with IEQ’s policies and processes Create recurring reports to track data flow and monitor processes Stay updated on industry and market trends and make recommendations accordingly Build and maintain code bases Qualifications At least 2 years of experience in an software engineering role Experience coding in Python, SQL or JavaScript and strong data management skills Experience developing for cloud services, Azure, AWS of GCP UX/UI Front End Developer experience preferred Information Technology or Cloud Infrastructure experience preferred Full Stack Developer experience a plus Ability to create and deliver compelling and clear presentations Strong project management skills Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail Ability to think critically and anticipate issues Good verbal and written communications skills Good relationship-building skills both inside and outside of the organization Ability to work in a fast-paced, high-volume, high-pressure environment Curious, excited to solve big data challenges, “No task is too small” mentality Bachelor’s degree is required Career Path Upward mobility aren’t just words on a page, it’s embedded in our culture. We look for individuals who are curious, who see gaps and find creative solutions, those who don’t stop until the work is done and always give more than what is asked. We value these individuals and want to see them grow and strive within the company. Compensation The total compensation range for this role, inclusive of base salary and bonus, is $90,000 - $125,000, depending on skills and experience.

title: Senior Business Analyst
description: Enables the End to End Supply Chain and solves information problems and requirements by analyzing pharmaceutical bulk drug-substance production, quality, raw material and supply chain requirements; by designing and maintaining site SAP Master Data; and providing data analysis of supply chain-related operations. Job Responsibilities Leads/ partners with internal and external stakeholders within Materials Management/Supply Chain, Manufacturing, Technology, Quality and Finance organizations to control the production master data lifecycle in SAP; design, develop, deploy, maintain, optimize, audit, and retire. Maintains a high-level understanding of the data related business processes and systems within/ outside the ERP system landscape to ensure SAP data domain compliance. Lead a data domain and support creating, modifying and maintaining of other SAP Master Data domains/Objects related to production and raw material masters, Recipes, Bill of Materials, Resources, COA Profiles, Inspection Plans and Characteristics, as well as other Info Record Data and ancillary support data. Improves data structure quality and supply chain process (planning, shipping, etc.) efficiency by studying current practices and designing data structure modifications. Own/support enterprise-wide SAP projects; participate in site user testing; provide user requirements review and input. Proactively identifying problems and own solutions for improving written procedures, business process instructions, workflows and training materials related to the Maintain Master Data business unit. Lead projects to determine operational objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formatting data sets to meet these needs. Define, monitor, and report out on project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases, and elements required to implement/modify associated master data. Executes work in accordance with Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) standards, regulations, and documentation. Prepares technical reports for production and supply chain stakeholders by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing transactional information and trends. Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing professional networks; benchmarking industry practices. Work independently on routine and non-routine production campaign-based activities; support the site Impact Projects under direction of manager or project lead. Job Requirements Education: BA/BS degree in computer science, supply chain, business, or engineering fields, or AS with equivalent work experience (6+ years), or Direct work experience within the biotech, pharmaceutical, or chemical manufacturing (10+ years). Experience (may vary depending on site size/scope) 6+ years of GMP experience in a biotech, pharmaceutical, or chemical manufacturing environment. 5-10 years of experience in managing product/material master data within SAP. Knowledge/Skills/Competencies Experience with use of computer-based systems, in a validated environment. Require prior direct SAP system (preferably R3P) use experience (ie - as end user, developing data, etc.). Able to organize large sets of electronic data in spreadsheets and databases. Possesses good problem solving, interpersonal, communication (written and verbal), team, and customer service skills. Able to partner with a variety of internal and external customers and partners, such as Supply Chain, Manufacturing, Technology, Quality and Finance departments. Exercises independent judgment and discretion to solve a variety of problems of moderate scope and complexity. Consistently model behaviors that reinforce safety in the workplace. APICS certification preferred. Knowledge and practical application of Lean and/or Six Sigma methodology preferred. Self-starter who takes personal accountability for delivering team outcomes and models high professional standards for self, and supports a speak-up/ psychologically safe work culture. Work Environment/Physical Demands/Safety Considerations Standard office environment

Own coordination, timeline planning, cross-functional meetings and follow-ups to ensure successful delivery of a complex execution space Effectively manage schedule to regularly attend meetings and deliver on accountable work Design framework & processes to facilitate cross team collaboration Provide support across multiple projects to ensure high-quality releases Produce qualitative and quantitative reporting to stakeholders Research new vendors within Trust Product domains Skills: Detail-oriented, highly organized and able to multitask Dynamic and very adaptable to a fast-paced changing environment Able to balance multiple conflicting priorities and negotiate trade-offs Communication skills - able to explain complex concepts both verbally and via written communications, including technical concepts Flexible and adaptable to change Excellent interpersonal skills (influence, empathy, clarity in communication) Focused on learning, growing and developing new skill-sets Proficiency in Google Suite (Gmail, Calendar, Sheets, Slides, etc) Familiarity with the Identity, Safety and Fraud Management methodologies a plus Education: 4+ years experience being a Partnerships/Vendor and/or Program Manager; driving/leading medium to large cross-functional efforts [Nice to have] Experience working in start-up or fast paced, do-it-yourself environment [Nice to have] Some experience in Trust, Privacy, Safety, Identity or Fraud Note: The Company is committed to complying with the California Privacy Rights Act (“CPRA”) effective January 1, 2023; and all data privacy laws in the jurisdictions in which it recruits and hires employees. title: Sr. Strategic Financial Analyst - Online Subscription Business
description: Company Description LinkedIn is the world’s largest professional network, built to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. Our products help people make powerful connections, discover exciting opportunities, build necessary skills, and gain valuable insights every day. We’re also committed to providing transformational opportunities for our own employees by investing in their growth. We aspire to create a culture that’s built on trust, care, inclusion, and fun – where everyone can succeed. Join us to transform the way the world works. Job Description At LinkedIn, we trust each other to do our best work where it works best for us and our teams. This role offers a hybrid work option, meaning you can both work from home and commute to a LinkedIn office, depending on what’s best for you and when it is important for your team to be together. We are looking for a Senior Financial Analyst who will be a key strategic business partner to our Online Subscription Businesses. As a member of this team, you will not only partner with cross functional teams, but you will play a central role in decisions affecting these businesses. You will be responsible for maintaining, analyzing, and communicating relevant business KPIs, proactively driving analyses to better inform our forecast models, expanding our various bottoms up models to reflect our business strategies, and providing strategic analyses and recommendations to our key stakeholders. Responsibilities : Define and drive data intense analyses aimed at developing a deep and holistic understanding of business performance, growth drivers, and trending. Present these analyses and key takeaways to stakeholders Define, maintain, understand, forecast, and communicate key KPIs for those businesses Drive complex financial modeling development, enhancement and maintenance of models and playbooks used to map out and track business performance across the full member lifecycle. Coordinate various planning cycles (annual and quarterly forecasts) and prepare weekly, monthly and quarterly management reviews Identify, diagnose, and resolve performance issues Manage and build financial/operational dashboards to monitor daily and weekly performance Act as a key business partner to product leads and other stakeholders to provide strategic financial insights and recommendations Qualifications Basic Qualifications: BA/BS degree in finance or related work experience 4+ years of financial analysis experience in a high-tech, or management consulting/investment banking 4+ years experience utilizing excel, including but not limited to fluency using arrays, iterative calculations, and model performance enhancements/optimizations 2+ years experience in analytics, modeling revenue, analyzing large datasets, and prioritizing across various deliverables Preferred Qualifications: Proactive, results oriented, with a can-do attitude Adaptable and able to react quickly to changing business needs Excellent communication, analytical, teamwork, organizational and interpersonal skills Strong understanding of data modeling and SQL Concise and effective communications: You’re able to articulately present and discuss recommendations with cross-functional teams Suggested Skills: Strategic Finance Data Analytics Financial Analysis Excel Modeling LinkedIn is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The pay range for this role is $82,000 to $133,000. Actual compensation packages are based on several factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, depth of experience, certifications, and specific work location. This may be different in other locations due to differences in the cost of labor. The total compensation package for this position may also include annual performance bonus, stock, benefits and/or other applicable incentive compensation plans. For more information, visit https://careers.linkedin.com/benefits. title: Tririga Business Analyst
description: Company Description Tanisha Systems, Inc, founded in 2002 in Massachusetts-USA, is a leading provider of Custom Application Development and end-to-end IT Services to clients globally. We use a client-centric engagement model that combines local on-site and off-site resources with the cost, global expertise, and quality advantages of off-shore operations. Our mission is to develop Outsource and Co-source Turnkey Projects for Government and Industries around the globe and yield higher productivity, higher profitability, and higher satisfaction for our clients. Our vision is to accelerate execution of our growth strategy while continuing to build our brand with clients, community, and our employees. Role Description This is a contract Tririga Business Analyst role with Tanisha Systems, located in San Jose, CA. As a Tririga Business Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing and documenting business requirements, configuring solutions, and supporting the implementation of the Tririga platform. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, conduct user workshops, and provide training and support to end users. This role requires strong analytical and problem-solving skills, as well as excellent communication and interpersonal abilities. Qualifications Minimum of 3 years of experience as a Business Analyst, preferably with expertise in the Tririga platform Strong understanding of business processes and ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions Experience with requirements gathering, process modeling, and solution design Knowledge of the Tririga application suite, including configuration, workflows, and integration Proficiency in SQL and data analysis Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and manage multiple priorities Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, or a related field Tririga certification is a plus

title: ServiceNow Business Analyst (HRSD)
description: Role name: ServiceNow Business Analyst (HRSD) Location: San Jose, CA (Onsite) Duration: 06+ Months Role Description Assist with the design, prototype, implement, test, and deploy technical solutions within ServiceNow Prepare as-is process documentation, to-be process documentation, and performing detailed gap analysis in partnership with HR tech and business teams Assist with request intake and working with core business stakeholders for routine enhancement requests or defects Document and refine RTB enhancements and defects Assists HRSD Tech Team with backlog management and design workshops Support upgrades, enhancements, testing, validation, and overall system performance Set testing criteria, build testing scripts, perform testing, and collaborate with business units to complete testing with objective to deliver quality product Contribute to change management and training efforts Writing/modifying stories in Jira Work with solutions architect, integration analysts and reporting teams to deliver the desired business objectives. Design, develop, troubleshoot, debug, and deploy technical solutions Support release management, reviews release summaries, and release readiness documents as needed Assist in building reports and dashboards in ServiceNow to meet business needs Experience (Years): 10 & Above Essential Skills ServiceNow System Admin Certification: Possessing the ServiceNow System Admin certification is essential , as it demonstrates a foundational understanding of the platform, enabling the analyst to support and maintain the HRSD application effectively. HRSD ServiceNow Platform Implementation Experience At least 2-3 years of experience in implementing HRSD ServiceNow platform features and functionality is crucial for the role, as it indicates a solid understanding of HRSD and related processes. Proficiency In HR Processes And Workflows The candidate must be familiar with HR processes and workflows to successfully design, implement, and support HRSD solutions aligned with business needs. Desirable Skills: HRSD Implementation Certification: Having the HRSD Implementation certification is a plus, as it shows specialized expertise in the HRSD scope and increases the candidates ability to support complex HR workflows and projects. Experience in HRSD Architecture: Understanding HRSD architecture is advantageous, as it allows the analyst to design and deliver robust solutions that meet business requirements and objectives. Experience with SLA Models: Familiarity with Service Level Agreement (SLA) models is beneficial, as it helps ensure timely and efficient delivery of services and support to the business teams and stakeholders.

title: Senior Manager, Business Analyst
description: Good American is the first fully inclusive fashion brand that celebrates all dimensions of female power. Offering quality, style, and substance in every size — 00-32, we are committed to challenging industry norms by empowering all women to feel sexy and confident no matter their size or shape. The brand was launched in October 2016, by Emma Grede and Khloé Kardashian, to empower all women to celebrate their bodies with confidence by offering high-quality designs in all sizes. What started as the largest denim launch in history, has evolved into an iconic and inclusive fashion line of denim, ready-to-wear, swim, shoes and activewear. As the Senior Manager of Business Analytics at Good American, you will be responsible for leading the development and execution of data-driven strategies to support the growth and profitability of our e-commerce, retail, and wholesale operations. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to analyze business performance, identify trends and opportunities, and provide insights that drive operational efficiencies and revenue growth. We are looking for someone with a broad technical background in data analytics, strong business acumen, who takes ownership of their work, and is focused on customer needs. The successful candidate will communicate crisply in non-technical terms to senior management. They will have an ability to make data-driven conclusions and will be comfortable with ambiguity while working in a fast-paced dynamic environment. Key Responsibilities the development and implementation of a comprehensive business analytics strategy that aligns with the company's goals and objectives. sales/transactional data, customer behavior, and market trends to provide insights and recommendations to key stakeholders across the organization. cross-functionally with ecomm, marketing, planning, merchandising and other teams to optimize marketing campaigns and promotions based on data-driven insights. in-depth analysis of existing business processes, systems, and workflows to identify areas for improvement and optimization. input drivers and validate integrity of the reporting to influence strategic decision-making and planning. data to identify disruptive ideas and provide recommendations to business leaders across the organization for growth and scalability. Interprets business needs and issues by gathering, eliciting, creating, analyzing, documenting and validating the Business areas user and/or technical (functional/non-functional) requirements. and maintain KPIs and dashboards to track and report on key performance metrics across e-commerce, retail, and wholesale channels. closely with the finance team to forecast sales, monitor budget performance, and support financial planning and analysis. internal and external stakeholders and data scientists to ensure accurate and timely delivery of analytics projects. up-to-date on industry best practices and emerging trends in business analytics to drive continuous improvement, efficiencies and innovation. Qualifications degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, or a related field years of experience in business analytics, preferably in the retail or e-commerce industry. analytical and problem-solving skills with proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques. understanding of data processes and how they relate to business objectives Experience leading a team and managing complex analytics projects. data mining abilities and natural curiosity to dig deep into the metrics to solve problems or identify opportunities. attention to detail and ability to work both independently and as a team-player under tight deadlines. communication and presentation skills with the ability to translate data insights into actionable recommendations. track record of driving business growth and profitability through data-driven decision-making in a fast paced retail industry of e-commerce platforms, retail operations, and wholesale distribution is a plus. in Looker, Shopify, Google Analytics, Big Query and other BI tools. SQL skills is a big plus. to work efficiently on a team and successfully collaborate on large projects. to think critically and complete deliverables in a fast-paced environment. $90,000 - $110,000 a year Please note that this role requires to be onsite four days a week. Good American participate in company-wide initiatives to advance social and environmental performance, such as sustainability training, DEI training, volunteering, or participation in internal committees. WE ARE B CORP CERTIFIED!!! As our business has grown so has our responsibility to our community, our planet and our business. Being B Corp certified means we will continue to put people and planet up there with profit.

title: Business Analyst
description: Overview This process-focused role will actively engage with business and technical staff to understand needs, define requirements, model processes, and ensure the quality of documentation meets defined standards. This role will coordinate with stakeholders and scrum teams to prioritize demands, test deliverables, and communicate release schedules. In this role, you will support the product owner to participate in and facilitate workshops, stakeholder and status meetings, and prioritization/alignment discussions. Deliverables include business requirement documents, functional specifications, process models and workflows, technical documentation, data visualizations, project plans and user stories, and policy and standards documentation. You will also serve as a librarian and central driver of internal documentation for the team and related functions. Responsibilities Work with requestors to document requirements, business value, outcomes, potential issues, compliance needs, and information classification Assist with the work intake process for the data management and governance team Facilitate conversations with business and technical staff to define and document processes, rules, service levels, and responsibilities Partner with developers to create and maintain technical documentation Report development, data validation, and end-user testing Requirements Bachelor's degree in business, mathematics, or related field 2+ years of experience in a similar role utilizing an architecture framework Strong verbal and written communication skills Experience creating and delivering presentations, project communications, and organizational change management Ability to work with all levels of management Strong analytical skills, including the ability to understand business needs and translate into requirements and business value (business case) Ability to set individual priorities and help a team plan tasks and organizational objectives Ability to work both independently and in a team environment Recommended Qualifications Working knowledge of core business platforms (SAP, Salesforce, Adobe, Microsoft) 2+ years of experience developing business process framework documentation, business analysis, and SDLC artifacts in a hybrid agile-project delivery model Knowledge of data structures, data warehousing, and SQL Familiarity with cloud computing and cloud data management tools Understanding of common frameworks (TOGAF, Zachman, ArchiMate) Experience creating reports and analytics using Excel, Power BI, or other BI tools Total Rewards Esri’s competitive total rewards strategy includes industry-leading health and welfare benefits: medical, dental, vision, basic and supplemental life insurance for employees (and their families), 401(k) and profit-sharing programs, minimum accrual of 80 hours of vacation leave, twelve paid holidays throughout the calendar year, and opportunities for personal and professional growth. Base salary is one component of our total rewards strategy. Compensation decisions and the base range for this role take into account many factors including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. A reasonable estimate of the base salary range is $66,560-$99,840 USD About Esri At Esri, diversity is more than just a word on a map. When employees of different experiences, perspectives, backgrounds, and cultures come together, we are more innovative and ultimately a better place to work. We believe in having a diverse workforce that is unified under our mission of creating positive global change. We understand that diversity, equity, and inclusion is not a destination but an ongoing process. We are committed to the continuation of learning, growing, and changing our workplace so every employee can contribute to their life’s best work. Our commitment to these principles extends to the global communities we serve by creating positive change with GIS technology. For more information on Esri’s Racial Equity and Social Justice initiatives, please visit our website here. If you don’t meet all of the preferred qualifications for this position, we encourage you to still apply! Esri is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please email askcareers@esri.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Please note that only those inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this e-mail address. Esri Privacy Esri takes our responsibility to protect your privacy seriously. We are committed to respecting your privacy by providing transparency in how we acquire and use your information, giving you control of your information and preferences, and holding ourselves to the highest national and international standards, including CCPA and GDPR compliance.

title: Business Process Analyst (GTM Planning, Sales Operations))
description: Job Title - Business Process Operations Analyst (GTM Planning) Duration - 06 months contract with possible extension Client Location - Atlanta, GA 30326 (50% Hybrid schedule) The ideal candidate will have prior work experience in Partner Ecosystems, Sales, Sales Strategy & Operations or Revenue Operations. The role requires strong analytical skills and unwavering attention to detail. You are self-motivated, results driven, and have experience presenting and communicating to different levels of leadership and collaborators across the organization. You are comfortable working independently and taking ownership while driving alignment & execution of transformative, cross-functional initiatives. Coordination of partner sales initiatives including collaboration with different stakeholders (Marketing, CSD, Sales, RevOps) to optimize pipeline impact and coverage when selling with or through partners and define the blueprint of engagement between the direct sales and the partner organization. Business process design aligned to operationalizing partner programs by ensuring the right processes, systems, enablement and reporting is in place to support program execution and ongoing success. Partner with Finance and Sales Operations in the annual budgeting and planning process including the execution of partner commissions and incentive programs. Monitor Relevant critical metrics and prepare relevant analysis to support senior management decision making, driving visibility and insight into the health of the business and the actions required to improve. Support business scalability through initiatives such as simplification and standardization of business processes including sharing of best practices across the teams and regions. Automate manual processes through business systems requirements analysis and design. Basic Qualifications 5+ years experience in GTM Sales Planning 5+ years experience in Business Process Design 5+ years Salesforce.com system experience 5+ years experience in Business Systems Requirements Development Other Qualifications Business Systems Requirements gathering and design Experience creating reports to support business operations in Tableau, Salesforce Lightning, and/or Excel. Experience in project management and business process documentation Ability to gather and translate business requirements from collaborators into technical specifications, including SFDC integration impacts and develop an action plan for associated internal systems as needed. Strong attention to detail with the ability to analyze and solve complex problems as well as provide documentation, guidance, and instruction to users. Ability to work independently, with general direction and guidance. Creative problem solver with a bias for action, understanding the value of structure while balancing the need for agility and innovation within that framework Proficient in Microsoft Suite and GSuite. Advanced/Expert user of Excel.

title: Business Analyst with Imaging experience
description: Business Analyst With Imaging Experience Location: Hybrid role (Onsite 3 days/week) at 1 DNA Way, South San Francisco, CA 94080. Experience 7+ years of relevant experience. Educational Qualifications Engineering Degree (BE/ME/BTech/MTech/BSc/MSc). Role And Responsibilities Part of the design team to define and align requirements with business asks. Convert business requirements (BRD) into technical requirement documents. Establish strong working relationships with business and other stakeholders. Gather product requirements and manage the backlog. Understand the customer business in the Biotech/Pharmaceutical industry, particularly with clinical trials and data management. Apply knowledge of Dicom Imaging Standards and related tools. Effectively communicate with team members and stakeholders. Implement Agile processes efficiently using tools like Jira. Required Skills And Experience Experience or understanding of the Biotech/Pharmaceutical industry, including clinical trials and data management. Knowledge of Dicom Imaging Standards and related tools. Strong experience in product requirement gathering and backlog management. Effective communication skills. Ability to establish strong working relationships with business and stakeholders. Strong understanding and experience with Agile processes and tools like Jira. Nice To Have Knowledge of cloud-based applications (AWS). Experience in SQL languages like PostgreSQL, MySQL, or MongoDB.

title: Business Analyst
description: Duration: 12 months with Possibility of extension Specific Qualifications Or Experience Required Minimum 5 years recent experience in Healthcare with a particular focus on IT systems and operational support Minimum 10 years’ experience in business analysis Must have experience with clinical information systems for Surgical, Critical Care, Medical Imaging and Cardiology, etc. in an acute care hospital setting. Must have experience with Surgical, Critical Care, Medical Imaging and Cardiology, etc. workflow and processes. Must have experience working with clinical information systems that use HL7 integration (eg. BizTalk) and DICOM Must have experience effectively communicating HL7 technical requirements to clinical stakeholders, and vice-versa, communicate clinical requirements to technical teams. Must have experience in supporting testing process (test strategy/plan, creating test cases, executing testing) Experience in managing complex projects that involve several integrated systems. It is an asset if the proponent has experience or knowledge of specific FH processes, downstream clinical applications, and end-to-end clinical and system workflows. Experience integrating downstream clinical applications with Meditech (eg: Coldfeed and discrete data integration) Demonstrated clinical stakeholder engagement experience. Proponent shall possess strong problem solving, analytical, organization, and interpersonal skills. Demonstrates strong written and verbal communication, documentation, and facilitation skills. Experience with clinical device integration is an asset. PMP or CBAP certification is an asset. Services Required: The “Advance Program” is looking for a business analyst for the Health Informatics & Clinical Ancillary Solutions (HI-CAS) team, with key deliverables and activities outlined below: Identify scope, system, site matrix confirming MEDITECH modules in scope by liaising with business areas and key stakeholders. Lead requirements gathering and development of clinical and technical workflows across portfolios in clinical information systems for Surgical, Critical Care, Medical Imaging and Cardiology, etc. in an acute care hospital setting. Develop Scope, Create Design Specifications and Transition to Operational documents for clinical information systems in scope. Identify, execute and manage risks and issues including pragmatic mitigation plans associated with this work-package. Work closely with the Integration Project lead to drive the day-to-day activities, as well as, ensure effective communication and escalation of risks and issues within the established project governance; Support creating an overall test strategy for various specialized clinical systems that integrate with MEDITECH EXPANSE. Lead integration (HL7) discussions with technical teams and clinical stakeholders, with the ability to effectively communicate technical requirements to clinical stakeholders, and vice-versa communicate requirements from clinical teams to technical teams. Coordinating and supporting teams through the design, build and test phases by preparing project documentation including design documents, work plans, and test plans/scripts. Working with teams and vendors to prepare for and to go-live in alignment with the project schedule (deliverables may include cut-over plans, go-live plans, and operational transition plans).

title: Business Analyst
description: Good morning - I have a new position with Fincons Group located in Los Angeles CA. Hybrid- must be available in Los Angeles Client prefers US citizen Contract to hire- 6 months + Your Target Rate to me is $50/hr The Business Analyst is sharply focused on identifying, documenting, and recommending solutions to business requirements from a technology, process, and workflow perspective. The Sr Business Analyst will successfully facilitate with stakeholders from various business units, supporting IT training, user acceptance testing, test scenarios, integrations, planning, coordination, and deployment of multi-team enhancements or projects. The role is responsible for contributing to the broader IT team in aligning technical and operational strategy through project execution. Responsibilities Demonstrate good knowledge of the complexities of the business and potential technical solutions, as well as a passion for driving large-scale projects. Contribute technical analysis to ensure that the delivered system functionality matches the specified requirements; ensure business satisfaction with IT services and products; understand and support communication of user expectations. Contribute to project execution, including taking a lead role in multi-track project plans, communicating updates to stakeholders, and providing weekly reports. Successfully identify opportunities to enhance existing IT processes and collaborate with process owners to introduce efficiencies. Successfully identify and articulate options to stakeholders and influence decisions based on facts and analysis. Establish and sustain relationships with critical subsidiary execution teams, including senior leaders, track leads, IT support, and other corporate partners, and P&O. Solicit, elaborate, and communicate requirements and/or issues to technical and non-technical stakeholders. Contribute with all internal IT communications and activities with Information Security, P&O, Finance, IT fulfillment teams and IT infrastructure teams. Contribute solutions as a subject matter expert by corresponding with regional counterparts and developing a global governance and shared services operating model. title: Business Analyst
