The Business Analyst will work with stakeholders to ensure that the requirements are met and will also work with the development team to ensure that the project is completed on time and within budget. Responsibilities: Gather and analyze business requirements Translate business requirements into technical specifications Work with stakeholders to ensure that requirements are met Work with the development team to ensure that the project is completed on time and within budget Document the project requirements and deliverables Communicate with stakeholders throughout the project lifecycle Manage project risks Identify and resolve project issues Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in business administration, information technology, or a related field Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Ability to work independently and as part of a team Ability to learn new technologies quickly Skills: Strong understanding of business processes Strong understanding of technical concepts Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to work independently and as part of a team Ability to learn new technologies quickly Work With Us Competitive pay Health, dental, vision, and life insurance Unlimited Paid Time Off 401(k) matching Laptop Remote Salary Description $50,000 - $70,000

title: Business Analyst
description: Job Description The HIT department is seeking a Business Analyst (BA) to be an entry/mid-level professional who can partner effectively with multiple levels of the organization, own and build Business Requirement Documents/User Stories, perform Quality Assurance (QA) and User Acceptance (UA) Testing, proactively identify and resolve problems, and work with Project Managers and other Business Analysts to secure HIT and Project Stakeholder acceptance of all requirements and documentation on all assigned projects. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Creates and owns all requirements artifacts in the project lifecycle: Scope of Work (SOW), Business Requirement Document (BRD) or User Stories, Quality Assurance (QA) and User Acceptance (UA) test plans, and Change Backlogs. Documents clear and concise meeting minutes for all project meetings, supports project manager(s) in project meetings, works with Sr. BA to prepare materials for presentations, user trainings, and user demos. Works with Sr. BA to ensure the products being developed comply with the needs of the customers. Provides frequent and clear communication to project managers and department leadership team on status of requirements, testing results, identified risks, potential scope creep, and changing requirements. Performs comprehensive QA testing, Regression Testing, and UAT to fulfill complete test plans with the guidance of Sr. BA for all projects prior to production release. Creates user documentation such as User Guides, Job Aids, Workflow Diagrams, Announcement Releases, and training materials. Provides technical and business specifications to Sr. Business Analyst for approval before use as internal and external Compliance audit materials. Manage requirements and ensure they are up to date and accurate in all project documentation. Supervise requirements traceability information and record requirements status throughout the project. Qualifications: High School graduate or GED equivalent Understanding of Managed Healthcare business operations EZ-CAP® experience is a plus 1+ years of related experience as Business Analyst that includes soliciting and building business requirements, creating test plans, performing QA and UA testing, creating user documentation, and/or maintaining applications or using applications in a business setting Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required: SQL query skills (MS SQL) is a plus Proficient in Microsoft Office applications Understanding of impact and root cause analysis Experience with project management software EDI knowledge is a plus Effective verbal and written communication skills Excellent interpersonal skills Ability to work under tight deadlines and handle multiple/detail-oriented tasks

title: Principal Business Analyst
description: Overview Rapiscan Systems,Inc. designs, manufactures and markets security and inspection systems worldwide. Our products range from hand held metal detectors to Real Time Tomography used to inspect baggage, cargo, people, vehicles and other objects for people, weapons, explosives, drugs, money, and other contraband. Rapiscan Systems security and inspection devices can be found in a wide range of locations such as, airports, border crossings, railway stations, seaports and terminals, government and military installations and nuclear facilities. Rapiscan Systems is looking for a Principal Business Analyst to join their team! This individual will assist the Global Service organization achieve financial performance targets through analysis and review of financial results at a very detailed level. They will also be assisting with development of strategies to grow the business and identify future risks as it relates to financial performance. Responsibilities Advises Global Service on all business-related issues affecting Service and performs analysis and reports that align with financial and strategic goals. Leads preparation, analysis and reviews of actuals with a focus on future risk and variance analysis at a detailed level by region with appropriate management levels. Summarize results and communicate business impacts to Service leadership. Supports monthly forecast process through support of the preparation of accurate Global top line sales and gross margin forecasts for the Global Service Team. Monitors and reviews monthly results and summarize key trends for management through data analysis. This job will require working with Regional Leaders, Service Operations Leaders, and Service Finance. The candidate must be willing to communicate, ask questions and work with these other Service leaders to accomplish team objectives. Able to work in a fast-paced environment and adapt quickly to changing requirements. Develops meaningful analytics to convey key drivers on growth and productivity. Identifies service opportunities for improvement through data analysis. Responsible for influencing execution of day-to-day activities related to Service, Proposals, including development of strategies necessary to achieve performance goals. Participates in proposals to achieve desired profit margins and business strategic elements through data analysis and lessons learned. Uphold the company’s core values of Integrity, Innovation, Accountability, and Teamwork. Demonstrate behavior consistent with the company’s Code of Ethics and Conduct. It is the responsibility of every employee to report to their manager or a member of senior management any quality problems or defects in order for corrective action to be implemented and to avoid recurrence of the problem. Duties may be modified or assigned at any time to meet the needs of the business. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Business or Finance required. 12+ years related experience highly desired. Possess strong interpersonal awareness in order to work with strong personalities and multiple levels of the organization. Demonstrated ability to prioritize concurrent requirements and accommodate numerous stakeholders. Must be flexible and willing to deal with a wide range of work assignments. Ability to work through problems with minimal supervision. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Knowledge and proficiency in key financial systems and ERP tools (Microsoft Dynamics 365, Excel, PowerPoint). Knowledge of Risk and Opportunities Management best practices. Extensive knowledge of financial costing/pricing, reporting, and invoicing requirements for multiple types of US Government contract vehicles (Time & Materials, Cost Plus Fixed-Fee, Firm-Fixed Price, hybrid). Moderate level of progressive Finance roles with strong analytical and partnering track record. Comfortable presenting to executive management and can clearly communicate ideas and articulate findings while maintaining a hands-on approach. Must organize/prioritize work, manage multiple tasks and projects and function effectively as a team member. Experience cross-training or supervising personnel a plus. OTHER WORK REQUIREMENTS: Successful completion of OSI training required (including training done at Company location). Ability to prioritize and manage multiple responsibilities in a fast-paced environment. Strong attention to detail and accuracy. Please review our benefits here: Life at OSI The specific programs and options available to any given employee may vary depending on eligibility factors such as geographic location and date of hire. Please note that the salary information shown above is a general guideline only. Salaries are based upon candidate experience and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations. title: Analyst, DTC Strategy

Join our team and contribute to crafting the future of entertainment. The DTC Streaming Strategy team tackles the most critical challenges and opportunities facing Disney+ and Hulu globally. Our recent high-impact streaming strategy projects include: Building business plans to launch new product features and streaming services (e.g. Hulu on Disney+, Disney+ Perks Program, Disney+ Premier Access) Assessing high-impact partnership and joint venture opportunities (e.g. Disney+/Hulu/MAX Bundle, Venu sports joint venture) Optimizing Disney+ and Hulu content slates and marketing investments to drive subscriber growth and retention Defining the five-year growth plan trajectory and developing new strategies for growth in each region of the world Crafting strategy materials for the Board of Directors and the investor community Responsibilities: Structure and build sophisticated financial models for pivotal business development opportunities and growth strategies Analyze subscriber engagement data to advise content and distribution strategies, helping to optimize the streaming viewer experience Conduct comprehensive market research to track industry trends and identify new opportunities for growth and innovation Develop executive-level presentations summarizing key insights and recommendations for streaming leadership and broader Disney leadership team Required Qualifications: Bachelor's degree from a top tier university 1-2 years of experience at a top tier investment bank, consulting firm, or comparable corporate strategy/development group Excel and PowerPoint wizardry, with experience building financial models Sharp analytical mind capable of structuring ambiguous problems Outstanding communication skills, both written and verbal Passion for the intersection of streaming entertainment and technology Preferred Qualifications: Prior experience in entertainment The hiring range for this position in Burbank, CA is $84,500 to $113,300 per year. title: Strategic Analyst
description: Rise Sports Collective stands at the forefront of transforming the professional sports industry through customized learning courses for sports teams and leagues. We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented Strategic Analyst to support our leadership team in executing the company’s strategic business priorities. The ideal candidate will be a quick learner, an adept problem solver, and possess strong interpersonal skills with a keen eye for data-driven insights and growth opportunities. As a crucial member of our dynamic team, you will have the opportunity to shape and influence the strategic direction of our business operations. This position offers a unique chance to engage directly with top-level projects and contribute significantly to our mission of revolutionizing Learning and Development in the Business of Sports. Join us in our journey to provide unmatched professional development in our industry and work alongside top teams and leagues. Key Responsibilities The Strategic Analyst should be able to handle multiple priorities and will be involved with many facets of the company, including: Strategic Support: Assist the leadership team in the formulation and execution of strategic initiatives by providing data-driven insights and recommendations. Operational Optimization: Streamline operations through detailed analysis and enhance internal communication to ensure alignment with the company’s strategic goals and timelines. Market Research: Conduct thorough research on industry trends and market conditions to identify new business opportunities and support business development efforts. Relationship Management: Support the maintenance of lasting relationships with clients and industry partners, serving as a key liaison to meet client needs and ensure high satisfaction levels. Industry Engagement: Keep abreast of industry best practices and innovations to maintain and strengthen client relationships and business strategies. Qualifications Industry Expertise: Strong knowledge of sports business and client engagement; prior consulting experience is a plus. Educational Background: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Sports Management, or a closely related field preferred. Professional Experience: 2-4 years of experience in a strategic or executive support role, ideally within a fast-paced, growth-oriented environment Communication Skills: Exceptional communication and presentation skills. Project Management: Proven ability to manage multiple projects independently and collaboratively in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. Passion for Sports: A deep passion for and understanding of the professional sports landscape. Bias toward Action: Resourcefulness, scrappiness, and proven ability to execute projects to completion. Join Our Team Are you ready to make a significant impact in the sports industry? If you are a dedicated professional looking for an opportunity to drive growth and innovation, we invite you to join our dynamic team at Rise Sports Collective. Together, we can shape the future of learning and development in the business of sports. Commitment To Inclusion Rise Sports Collective is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to diversity and creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Exact compensation may vary based on skills, experience, and location. Base salary: Up to $75,000/yr Pay range in California, United States

Ability to work independently and as part of a team, demonstrating initiative and accountability. Proficiency in project management methodologies and tools (e.g., Agile, Waterfall, MS Project). Knowledge of healthcare regulations and compliance, particularly related to PACE programs. Ability to adapt to changing priorities and work in a fast-paced environment. Commitment to continuous learning and professional development. Education & Training Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Healthcare Management, or a related field. Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and make data-driven decisions. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with diverse teams. Proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, SQL, Tableau, etc.). Knowledge of healthcare regulations and compliance, particularly related to PACE programs. Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple priorities. title: Business Analyst - Healthcare
description: Do you have healthcare business analyst skills? Do you like challenging clinical and financial analysis? Our Decision Support team could be for you. We love what we do and would like to meet you! This is not an IT position. In this position you will: Build out hospital contracts Create ad hoc reports Perform both clinical and financial analysis Use data for testing, auditing, and validation Serve as a resource to department managers and facilitate their use of data Skills Needed Strong Excel and math skills Understanding of database functionality and reporting tools Advanced data analysis and interpretation of trends Good communication at all levels Any knowledge of a Decision Support system or hospital contracting is advantageous. We are currently doing multiple system optimizations. Prior implementation knowledge in an end user role is helpful, not as a coder, but as a user of the data for testing, audit and/or validation. This position applies advanced knowledge of clinical and financial analysis and knowledge of systems technology to identify and design solutions within the decision support, research and quality systems. Responsible for the development of Service Line analyses and the monitoring of trends. Works across departments to provide supportive information for various initiatives including productivity, business planning, volume trend analysis, case mix index, reimbursement and costing. Handles the integration and comparison of internal data with various benchmarks (e.g., NACHRI, OSHPD, Thomson Reuters, and PHIS). This role encompasses all areas of the hospital and provides an opportunity to gain valuable, well-rounded skills. Rady Children's promotes from within and this position can lead to exciting future opportunities! We allow remote work, with the flexibility to come in on an as-needed basis for any meetings that will not be handled virtually. Those times can be flexible, and any time in the office would be at the Copley Business Center location in Kearny Mesa. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's Degree 3 years of experience Ability to prepare complex written and graphic reports that explain and interpret data trends Ability to develop a query and return accurate data files to serve as the foundation of the analysis Basic hospital financial reporting and experience with both financial and clinical analyses in a healthcare setting Ability to perform complex analysis using modeling, forecasting and statistical analysis methodologies Knowledge of healthcare terminology, coding practices, and KPI definitions Ability to work effectively in a multi-faceted, time-critical work environment Ability to manage and manipulate files maintaining content integrity Ability to work with decision-makers to define the parameters of an analysis data set Knowledge of effective organizational and management principles Knowledge of Service Line management and accountability practices Preferred Qualifications Master's Degree 5+ years of experience The expected hiring range for this position is $35.84 to $49.28. Rady Children’s Hospital is committed to compensation that is externally competitive and internally equitable. We demonstrate this commitment by conducting regular market reviews to remain competitive with organizations of similar size in the nonprofit, healthcare sector. The range listed above does not represent the full salary range for the position but is the expected hiring range for qualified candidates. Compensation decisions consider a variety of factors including experience, education, licensure, unique skillsets, organizational need, and internal equity.

title: Business Analyst
description: About NEXGEN NEXGEN Asset Management is the industry-leading asset management software that combines a robust computer maintenance management system with advanced asset management planning tools. Based on over 25 years of practical asset management program and software implementation experiences, NEXGEN Asset Management is a web-based software developed specifically to support a comprehensive asset management program. Job Description As a Business Analyst, you will be assigned to projects within the Product Delivery, Software Development, and Implementation Services teams as dictated by business need. You will work with colleagues and stakeholders to investigate and model business functions, processes, information flows and data structures using a range of business analysis techniques. Your input will be utilized in the development and enhancement of a client facing product, implementation of new client business, data analysis, and review of existing business and processes. This position is full-time in our Sacramento, CA office and will report to the President. Your direct report will be determined by the assignment(s) you receive. Job Duties Current State Analysis: Coordinate with legacy system users/subject matter experts to understand the current state. Document existing processes and procedures and prepare meaningful and easily understood process diagrams using standard diagramming software such as Microsoft Visio. Future State Analysis Coordinate with business stakeholders to document and ensure business requirements, processes/workflows, use cases, user stories and key system capabilities are created and stored in a shared environment. Keep developed documents current as part of the implementation process. Analyze processes and recommend improvements for architecting new processes, which will address identified gaps and increase process efficiency and effectiveness. Testing And Quality Assurance Develop use cases and user stories as a key communication tool between the business and system delivery resources. Collaborate with stakeholders and project managers to prioritize use cases/user stories to support a phased delivery implementation. Partner with business stakeholders to develop business cases and project charters. Training & Support Documentation Maintain comprehensive documentation of system configurations, changes, and processes for reference and training. Assist in end-user training and support of the delivered solution. In partnership with the Client Education team, assist with the creation of job aids, user guides, and/or additional training and support collateral to support the to-be implementation. Issue Resolution Partner with stakeholders and delivery partners to track, investigate, and resolve system-related issues. Perform other duties as assigned by the project managers. Required Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in computer science or information systems from an accredited college or university Minimum 5 years of experience as a functional business analyst for CMMS or EAM-related projects, preferably across multiple hardware and software platforms Ability to work independently as an individual contributor on complex, large-scale cloud-based applications Demonstrated success documenting and delivering CMMS/EAM IT implementation projects Demonstrated proficiency in business process/workflow automation Previous experience preparing business cases or writing project deliverables, including functional requirements technical memorandums, user stories, and requirements traceability matrix Excellent written and verbal communication skills with technical and non-technical stakeholders, including the ability to effectively communicate with internal staff and external customers Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines Ability to work independently and carry out assignments to completion within parameters of instructions given Attention to detail and commitment to delivery high-quality results Highly organized Experience with data analysis and migration Preferred Prior project delivery experience Knowledge of municipal utilities and/or public works Understanding of relationship databases Salary range of $70,000 - $80,000 per year based on experience. This is a full-time position based in the Sacramento, CA office and will report to the President. Nexgen Core Values Courage – Do the right thing & do not be afraid of taking smart risks Be bold and make intelligent decision Take initiative even when faced with adversity Innovation – Promote innovation & continuous improvement Approach work with intellectual curiosity Follow best practices of the industry Respect – Treat others with respect & professionalism Be honest, open, and forthright Approach the organization, clients and team with integrity Proactive – Anticipate & take the initiative to achieve results Be aware of situation and environment Anticipate needs and take initiative to address Results – Deliver exceptional results Hold yourself accountable to deliverables and deadlines Strive for excellence Community – Build a community of co-workers and clients Family-driven culture of teamwork Connect on a personal level with team and clients Why Work At Nexgen Engage with an innovative and intelligent team Fun & progressive culture in a dog-friendly office Flexible work environment Competitive salaries and room for growth Excellent benefits NEXGEN is an equal opportunity employer who celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

title: Supply Chain Business Operations - Business Analyst V

We are a team of world-class experts developing and shipping products at the intersection of hardware, software, and content. As the Supply Chain Business Operations - Business Analyst V for VR Devices, you will play a crucial role in advancing our business objectives pertaining to Strategic Sourcing and Supply Chain management by consolidating and analyzing business data, solving critical business issues and providing meaningful business intelligence and insights for decision making throughout product life cycles. and disseminate risks, opportunities, and intelligence as it relates to supply chain Create cross functional forums to discuss and bring best supply chain solutions as it relates to Strategic Sourcing Develop, manage and maintain processes and tools to measure supplier performance Digitize the inputs and provide condensed formats to sourcing managers to discuss supplier performance with suppliers comparisons and other supply chain parameters such as Lead Time, Spend, BOM Costs, Part-level attribute analysis, Supplier and Commercial attribute overviews, etc. Demonstrated experience in designing large scale supply chain systems Demonstrated experience in managing large projects spanning multiple years and multiple organizations Communication skills (whitepapers, process documentations, Wikis, PowerPoint/Keynote presentations) Demonstrated understanding of supply chain tools such as E2OPEN, Oracle, SAP etc. Preferred Qualifications: MBA and/or advanced engineering graduate degree Experience dealing with leadership at all levels. title: Business Analyst I
description: Overview Join our team of dedicated professionals who provide services and operational support to award winning hospitals through roles in supply chain, IT and cybersecurity, clinical engineering, capital procurement, medical coding, project management and more. We provide services to clinically excellent community hospitals across the country that are dedicated to ensuring quality, compassionate care for every patient, every time. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against applicants due to veteran status, disability, race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, or other protected characteristics. If you need special accommodation for the application process, please contact Human Resources. Know Your Rights: https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/2022-10/EEOC_KnowYourRights_screen_reader_10_20.pdf Privacy Notice for California Applicants: https://www.primehealthcare.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/04/Notice-at-Collection-and-Privacy-Policy-for-California-Job-Applicants.pdf Responsibilities Reports to department Director and provides analytic support for a wide variety of data domains and business data needs. The Business Analyst leads multiple concurrent projects as well as provides data strategic initiatives and decisions. Analyzes complex business problems and issues using data from internal and external sources to provide insight to decision-makers. Identifies and interprets trends and patterns in datasets to locate influences. Constructs forecasts, recommendations and strategic/tactical plans based on business data and market knowledge. Creates specifications for reports and analysis based on business needs and required or available data elements. Collaborates with clients to modify or tailor existing analysis or reports to meet their specific needs. May participate in management reviews, including presenting and interpreting analysis results, summarizing conclusions, and recommending a course of action. Qualifications Education and Work Experience Bachelor's Degree Business Administration or Engineering preferred. Experience in analysis, interpretation and reporting data sets. Advanced analytical and problem solving skills. Ability to make recommendations to management through presentations or written reports. Experience using varied statistical methods. Strong written and verbal communications skills. Experience managing revenue generating projects. Strong planning and organization, critical thinking and decision-making skills. Ability to analyze complex problems and recommend solution. Good general business skills, high degree of confidentiality, maturity, tactfulness and business ethics. High degree of self-motivation, commitment and integrity. Proficiency in MS Suite a plus BioMedical Services, Inc. offers competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package that provides employees the flexibility to tailor benefits according to their individual needs. Our Total Rewards package includes, but is not limited to, paid time off, a 401K retirement plan, medical, dental, and vision coverage, tuition reimbursement, and many more voluntary benefit options. Benefits may vary based on employment status, i.e. full-time, part-time, per diem or temporary. A reasonable compensation estimate for this role, which includes estimated wages, benefits, and other forms of compensation, is $66,560.00 to $95,680.00 on an annualized basis. The exact starting compensation to be offered will be determined at the time of selecting an applicant for hire, in which a wide range of factors will be considered, including but not limited to, skillset, years of applicable experience, education, credentials and licensure.

title: Business Solutions Analyst
description: Position: Business Solutions Analyst Location: Los Angeles, CA Onsite Duration: 12+ months Position Type :W2 Remote - CA locals only Required Skills The Business Solutions Analyst will possess knowledge and experience in structured analysis principles and methods; systems analysis and analytical principles, concepts, techniques and methods, including cost-benefit analysis methods; basic IT architecture and technical documentation methods; systems design tools, methods and techniques, including automated systems analysis and design tools sufficient to develop requirements and specifications for systems that meet business requirements; systems design standards, policies and authorized approaches sufficient to assist in identifying and specifying business requirements for new or enhanced systems and develop basic system specifications; system design precedents or alternative approaches sufficient to advise on the merits of proposed systems development projects; business processes, workflows and operations of customer organizations sufficient to apply a structured systems analysis approach to the design and development of new or enhanced applications; business process engineering concepts and methods sufficient to lead/conduct studies designed to identify potential improvements in the way IT is applied to key business functions; life cycle management concepts; internet and new IT technologies; and speak and write effectively and prepare effective reports. This classification must have a minimum of five (5) years of experience applying analytical processes on IT projects. Three to five years of experience with (1) Microsoft Dynamics 365, and (2) Agile Scrum. Three to five years developing user stories and acceptance criteria in Azure Dev Ops.

title: Sr. Agile Business Analyst
description: ADP is hiring a Senior Agile Business Analyst in San Dimas, CA. Are you empathetic to client needs and inspired by transformation and impacting the lives of millions of people every day? Have you taken products from concept to commercialization using the latest technology and achieved market success? Are you looking to join a dynamic, inclusive team environment with a culture of collaboration and belonging? Well, this may be the role for you. Ready to design what's next? In this role, you will work alongside a team of friendly, passionate, and creative product managers and developers to bring our products to market. You create product release plans that ensure our teams develop solutions using next generation payroll, time, HR, leave, or benefits solutions. You'll make them easier to use and help our clients stay compliant, manage costs, and save time. We're looking for someone who excels when no two days are the same. Integrity, resilience, and pushing the boundaries are must-haves in this job. Whether you're in meetings with clients or sales, developers, or design, you'll be the guiding voice that helps us clarify ideas so we can create a product roadmap. You stay close to market trends, anticipate our customers' next questions, and bring new ideas into the mix. You love evangelising about your product and communicate with confidence. Still, you also have the experience to take your product into the marketplace and position it competitively for maximum financial impact. To thrive in this role, you must take command of your product, lead multiple team's efforts, and be a deep listener who can ask the right clarifying questions to help understand the problem your stakeholders are trying to solve. You've worked with Agile teams and understand product delivery cycles. You have experience explaining the prioritization of a product roadmap, creating that roadmap, and documenting in a way that both external and internal teams will understand. You have held roles where you regularly communicate and defend ideas to a broad audience of stakeholders. Our best product managers are domain experts and enthusiastic creators who stay current on the latest trends. As part of our team, your voice will influence product success and help shape our industry. Like what you see? Apply now! Learn More About ADP At Tech.adp.com/careers A little about ADP: We are a global leader in HR technology, offering the latest AI and machine learning-enhanced payroll, tax, HR, benefits, and much more. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating an inclusive, down-to-earth culture that welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. ADP has a deep commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion as a global Best Places to Work, DiversityInc® Top 50 Company, Best CEO and company for women, LGBTQ+, multicultural talent, and more. Learn more about ADP's commitment on our YouTube channel: http://adp.careers/DEI_Videos What You'll Do Here's what you can expect on a typical day: Participate effectively in relevant aspects of software development life cycle (SDLC) including planning, construction, testing, reviews, and demonstrations. Collaborate with team to design, develop, test, and refine deliverables. Collaborate with clients, Product, Architects, & Analysts to develop and review requirements & design. Play a key role in bridging technical and business aspects of Data Science and Analytic projects, ensuring that the scopes are feasible, aligned with technical capabilities' roadmap, market maturity, and targeted towards tangible business values. Identify project risks and develop mitigation strategies to minimize their impact on project outcomes. Proactively address issues and obstacles that arise during project execution, ensuring timely resolution. Serve as the point of contact for stakeholders, providing regular updates on project status, milestones, and risks. Monitor project performance metrics and implement corrective actions as needed to stay on track. Document User Stories and Acceptance criteria in Jira. Lead / Coach teams new to Agile / Scrum methodologies. Participate in project planning and release management. Expected to work on multiple projects at a time. To Succeed In This Role You'll have a Bachelor's degree OR equivalent. Requires a minimum of 4 years Technical Project Management Experience 3 - 5 years of experience working with Python and SQL 4+ years of JIRA/Confluence experience 4+ years of familiarity with cloud technologies (Databricks, Snowflake) 4+ years of Tableau or other visualization tools (PowerBI, Looker) Expert problem-solving skills to rapidly create ad-hoc queries to answer complex business questions or debug data issues Proficiency in project management methodologies such as Agile, Scrum, or Waterfall. Ability to work co-operatively as part of a team, as well as independently Excellent verbal and written communication skills Preferred Qualifications (Preference will be given to candidates who have the following) Bachelor's Degree or its equivalent in education and experience with a major area of concentration in Computer Science, Engineering or Math Knowledge of Spark or similar big data tools and technology is preferred Working experience in the HCM software or financial industry PMP or other accredited Project Management certifications You'll Love Working Here Because You Can Deliver at epic scale. We deliver real user outcomes using strong judgment and good instincts. We're obsessed with the art of achieving simplicity with a focus on client happiness and productivity. Be surrounded by curious learners. We align ourselves with other smart people in an environment where we grow and elevate one another to the next level. We encourage our associates to listen, stay agile, and learn from mistakes. Act like an owner & doer. Mission-driven and committed to leading change, you will be encouraged to take on any challenge and solve complex problems. No tasks are beneath or too great for us. We are hands-on and willing to master our craft. Give back to others. Always do the right thing for our clients and our community and humbly give back to the community where we live and work. Support our associates in times of need through ADP's Philanthropic Foundation. Join a company committed to equality and equity. Our goal is to impact lasting change through our actions. What are you waiting for? Apply today! Find out why people come to ADP and why they stay: https://youtu.be/ODb8lxBrxrY (ADA version: https://youtu.be/IQjUCA8SOoA ) Base salary offers for this position may vary based on factors such as location, skills, and relevant experience. Some positions may include additional compensation in the form of bonus, equity or commissions. We offer the following benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Matched Retirement Savings, Wellness Program, Short-and Long-Term Disability, Charitable Contribution Match, Holidays, Personal Days & Vacation, Paid Volunteer Time Off, and more. The compensation for this role is $60,500.00 - $162,000.00 / Year Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP: ADP is committed to an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace, and is further committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic including: race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, protected veteran status or disability. Hiring decisions are based upon ADP’s operating needs, and applicant merit including, but not limited to, qualifications, experience, ability, availability, cooperation, and job performance. Ethics at ADP: ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Click https://jobs.adp.com/life-at-adp/ to learn more about ADP’s culture and our full set of values.

title: Analyst, Content Analysis, Business Strategy & Planning
description: Job Title: Analyst, Content Analysis, Business Strategy & Planning Department: Strategy & Innovation Location: Santa Monica, CA, US, 90404 Summary of Position Content Analysis is a highly visible, cross-functional team that works closely with senior executive management across Lionsgate’s Motion Picture Group (MPG). We play a critical role in how executives interpret financial analyses to make greenlight decisions on content investment, distribution, active deal negotiations, M&A and strategic equity investments, and overall MPG strategy to ensure Lionsgate’s growth in a rapidly evolving media landscape. The team collaborates across key business units (such as Production & Acquisitions, Global Products & Experiences, Business & Legal Affairs, Global Sales & Distribution, and Global Marketing) to provide actionable insights on complex and exciting business opportunities across films, gaming, location-based entertainment, and new and emerging media. The team is seeking a highly qualified and motivated candidate for the position of Analyst, Content Analysis. This individual will play a vital role in facilitating the greenlight process, formulating and executing a wide range of deliverables that serve the strategic operations of the company, and will have a front row seat to help develop new ways of doing business inside the industry’s largest independent motion picture studio. We are looking for someone who excels at high-level, critical, and analytical thinking with an ability to simplify highly complex information and add meaningful context to economic profiles. This is an ideal role for someone who wants to learn the ins and outs of the motion picture business, disrupt the status quo, and find new ways to grow our business and deliver content to global audiences. Responsibilities Play an integral role within the Content Analysis team to manage the overall greenlight process for Lionsgate’s Motion Picture Group Develop P&Ls and related financial analyses for films, games, live/stage shows, and more from inception, to greenlight, to release, to post-release Model and analyze talent, distribution, and equity deals while working closely with executives at all levels throughout the deal negotiation process Evaluation of profit/loss, NPV, and IRR for individual projects and overall business units to ensure adherence to MPG Content Strategy and alignment to target financial KPIs Provide ad hoc financial modeling and analyses related to strategic projects across the company; e.g., M&A due diligence, deal and organizational structuring, and business development Work cohesively with Financial Planning & Analysis team, especially during quarterly forecast & Annual Plan, to connect the dots on how individual content decisions impact the overall MPG P&L Participate in the development and management of the business plan(s) of the MPG and individual sub-segments, and seek solutions for internal business performance improvement and operating efficiencies Create and maintain high-level reporting for the Chair of MPG, EVP of Business Strategy & Planning, MPG Division leads, and C-Suite executives Qualifications and Skills 2+ years of relevant experience (Entertainment industry experience preferred; prior experience in investment banking, management consulting, corporate strategy, business development or strategic planning in a leading media company is a plus) Must have outstanding Excel and financial modeling skills, and moderate proficiency in PowerPoint/Office (experience with VBA and/or financial consolidation tools is a plus) Intellectual curiosity, strong desire to learn, and a passion for media, entertainment, and technology Detail oriented and exceptional organizational skills, including the ability to prioritize multiple deliverables and manage toward evolving deadlines Must possess strong leadership qualities to motivate and persuade others to accomplish organizational objectives in a unified and fluent manner Strong work ethic, high sense of urgency, and ability to work extended hours Excellent written and verbal communication skills The successful candidate will have the aptitude to tackle multiple projects, problem solve, and efficiently execute deliverables and be expected to interact with and present to senior executives at all levels within the Motion Picture Group About the Company Lionsgate (NYSE: LGF.A, LGF.B) encompasses world-class motion picture and television studio operations aligned with the STARZ premium global subscription platform to bring a unique and varied portfolio of entertainment to consumers around the world. The Company’s film, television, subscription and location-based entertainment businesses are backed by a 17,000-title library and a valuable collection of iconic film and television franchises. A digital age company driven by its entrepreneurial culture and commitment to innovation, the Lionsgate brand is synonymous with bold, original, relatable entertainment for audiences worldwide. Business Unit Overview Motion Picture Group Lionsgate’s motion picture business is a consistent box office market share leader with films that have grossed more than $10 billion worldwide over the past six years. This leadership is driven by world-class talent relationships, a deep and renewable portfolio of iconic brands and franchises, and a diverse and balanced slate that is built to enhance consumer enjoyment of the theatrical experience but also has the flexibility to utilize a broad range of alternative release strategies as the opportunities to monetize films continue to expand. The creator, owner and distributor of great film brands including The Hunger Games, Twilight Saga, John Wick, Now You See Me, Knives Out, La La Land, Saw, Dirty Dancing and Monster’s Ball, among many others, films released by Lionsgate and its predecessor companies have earned 129 Academy Award® nominations and 32 Oscar® wins. In addition to its mainstream commercial releases, Lionsgate’s Motion Picture Group includes specialty film distributor Roadside Attractions, an industry leader in award-winning prestige movies, Pantelion Films, the U.S. market leader in Spanish-language releases, a top film production and distribution brand in the UK, and multiplatform distributor Grindstone Entertainment. Our Benefits Full Coverage – Medical, Vision, and Dental Work/Life Balance – generous sick days, vacation days, holidays, and Impact Day 401(k) company matching Tuition Reimbursement (up to graduate degree) Compensation $66,560 - $75,000 EEO Statement Lionsgate is an equal employment opportunity employer. All employees and applicants are evaluated on the basis of their qualifications, consistent with applicable state and federal laws. In addition, Lionsgate will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. Lionsgate will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and federal law.

title: Business Analyst
description: Description **Job Summary:** We are seeking a meticulous and proactive Regulatory Compliance Business Analyst with a focus on the Digital Operational Resilience Act (DORA) to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring our organization’s operations and processes comply with DORA regulations. This role involves analyzing regulatory requirements, developing compliance strategies, and working closely with various departments to implement and maintain compliance measures. Key Responsibilities **Regulatory Analysis:** Stay updated with DORA regulations and interpret their impact on business operations. Analyze regulatory changes and assess their implications for the company. **Compliance Strategy Development:** Develop and implement strategies to ensure compliance with DORA. Work with management to integrate compliance strategies into overall business plans. **Process Improvement:** Identify gaps in current processes and develop action plans to address them. Recommend and implement process improvements to enhance compliance and operational efficiency. **Risk Management:** Conduct risk assessments related to DORA compliance. Develop and implement risk mitigation strategies. **Documentation and Reporting:** Prepare detailed reports on compliance status, risk assessments, and mitigation plans. Maintain comprehensive documentation of compliance activities. **Training and Support:** Provide training and support to staff on DORA compliance requirements. Develop training materials and conduct workshops as needed. **Collaboration:** Work closely with IT, legal, risk management, and other departments to ensure a unified approach to compliance. Collaborate with external auditors and regulatory bodies as required. **Monitoring and Auditing:** Monitor compliance with DORA on an ongoing basis. Conduct regular audits to ensure adherence to regulatory requirements. **Experience:** Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in regulatory compliance, with a focus on DORA or similar regulations. **Knowledge:** In-depth understanding of DORA regulations and their application in a business context. Familiarity with risk management and compliance frameworks. **Skills:** Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. **Technical Proficiency:** Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and compliance management software. DORA regulatory knowledge is a nice to have, ideally other financial compliance experience or regulatory experience. Hybrid on-site in Newport beach, 6 month contract. About TEKsystems We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. title: Strategy Analyst
description: What you can expect! Find joy in serving others with IEHP! We welcome you to join us in “healing and inspiring the human spirit” and to pivot from a “job” opportunity to an authentic experience! Under the general supervision of the Strategy Analytics Manager, the Strategy Analyst is responsible for modeling healthcare related problems, discovering insights and identifying opportunities using data mining, analysis, and data visualization techniques. In addition to advanced analytical skills, the Strategy Analyst will display proficiency at integrating and preparing varied datasets, architecting analytical databases and visualization environments, and communicating results that meet or exceed business requirements. The Strategy Analyst must be able to assess requests and solicit feedback from requestors regarding any critical decision points that are necessary to complete requests accurately and timely. Projects include independently to produce Strategy technical documentation, to communicate with end business users, to create ad-hoc reports, databases, systems, reporting tables, and to automate complex Strategy reports. This role must provide high technical skill to troubleshoot and solve most technical issues, and act as a liaison with IT for issues that are higher in technical complexity. Incumbents are expected to exercise independent judgment in selecting study approach and analytical techniques, and in making sound recommendations. Key Responsibilities 1. Be an extraordinary example and a champion in living IEHP’s Mission, Vision and Values (MVV) every day, and strongly commit to advance the organization’s strategic plan. 2. Utilize technical and analytical expertise in data design, data collection, reporting and monitoring activities for strategy enrollment initiatives. 3. Execute enhancements on new strategies or future workflows utilizing expertise in current business processes. 4. Troubleshoot and solve most technical issues using expert technical skills, and act as the Strategy liaison with IT to streamline, troubleshoot and resolve issues that are higher in technical complexity. 5. Develop ad-hoc report using programming logic based on business requirements to extract healthcare, membership and revenue data for reporting purposes. 6. Create/maintain critical reference table(s) to import data from IEHP partners and internal department analysts to utilize. 7. Pull and manipulate data requests for ad hoc analysis as required by analysts within the team(s). 8. Mentor and train analysts on how to use and pull data from the SQL database. 9. Create, up-date, and modify existing reporting tables from scratch based on business requirements. 10. Write queries and stored procedures in SQL Server efficiently in order to meet reporting requirements. In addition, automate as many standard enrollment reports as possible. 11. Perform QA testing and data validation of output to ensure that the results are fit for business needs. The requirements include developing and writing queries to verify the accuracy of the data output. 12. Collaborate with other IEHP departments and data stewards to assess and prioritize needs, and assist with developing strategies, plans, policies and procedures related to providing effective reporting solutions. 13. Aid Strategy units in providing technical skills in real time for troubleshooting, reporting, etc. Commitment to Quality: The IEHP Team is committed to incorporate IEHP’s Quality Program goals including, but not limited to, HEDIS, CAHPS, and NCQA Accreditation. Perks IEHP is not only committed to healing and inspiring the human spirit of our Members; we also aim to match our Team Members with the same energy by providing prime benefits and more CalPERS retirement 457(b) option with a contribution match Generous paid time off- vacation, holidays, sick State of the art fitness center on-site Medical Insurance with Dental and Vision Paid life insurance for employees with additional options Short-term, and long-term disability options Pet care insurance Flexible Spending Account – Health Care/Childcare Wellness programs that promote a healthy work-life balance Career advancement opportunities and professional development Competitive salary with annual merit increase Team bonus opportunities Education & Experience Four (4) or more years of experience database administration and development, using Microsoft SQL Server or similar relational database application Four (4) or more years of experience of programming experience with Structured Query Language Must possess experience, knowledge and understanding of database development, lifecycle management, tools, and cross-functional activities Bachelor’s degree in a Health, Business, or related field from an accredited institution required Key Qualifications Communicate clearly and effectively both in speaking and in writing Data analysis, word processing, spreadsheet, and some database capabilities High attention to detail and accuracy Start your journey towards a thriving future with IEHP and apply TODAY !

title: Business Valuation Analyst
description: Job Title: Business Valuation Analyst Job Type: Full-time Job Description: As a Business Valuation Analyst, you will play a crucial role in conducting valuations of businesses across various industries. You will work closely with senior team members to analyze financial data, perform industry research, and apply valuation methodologies to determine the value of businesses and intangible assets. Your insights and analyses will be used to support client transactions, financial reporting, tax planning, and strategic decision-making. Roles And Responsibilities Conduct detailed financial statement analysis and cash flow modeling to assess the financial health and performance of businesses. Perform in-depth industry and market research to understand the competitive landscape and economic conditions impacting businesses. Utilize valuation techniques such as discounted cash flow (DCF), comparable company analysis, precedent transactions, and option pricing models to estimate the value of businesses and assets. Prepare comprehensive valuation reports and presentations summarizing methodologies, assumptions, and findings for clients and stakeholders. Collaborate with cross-functional teams including legal, finance, and operations to gather necessary information and insights for valuations. Stay updated on industry standards, regulations, and best practices related to business valuation. Assist in developing financial models and tools to streamline valuation processes and enhance accuracy. Support senior team members in client meetings, presentations, and discussions regarding valuation methodologies and findings. Skills Required Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field. Master’s degree or professional certification (CFA, ASA, ABV) preferred. Strong analytical skills with proficiency in financial modeling and valuation techniques. Solid understanding of accounting principles, financial statements, and financial analysis. Excellent research skills with the ability to gather, analyze, and synthesize complex data. Proficiency in using financial databases and software (e.g., Bloomberg, Capital IQ, Excel, VBA). Effective communication skills with the ability to present complex information clearly and concisely. Detail-oriented mindset with a commitment to accuracy and quality in work. Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. Compensation: The compensation package for this position includes a competitive salary commensurate with experience, performance-based bonuses, comprehensive benefits (healthcare, retirement, etc.), and opportunities for professional development and career advancement within our organization.

title: Senior Business Analyst
description: Job Description: Senior Business Analyst Job Location: Culver City, CA - Hybrid Schedule (Tue-Wed-Thur) Onsite Key Skills: Solid BA Skills, Music Industry experience is required, understanding of the overall media and OTT landscape, must be proficiency in Excel and Keynote Should have experience in Number Analysis Business Development - Apple Media The people here at Apple don't just create products - they create the kind of wonder that's revolutionized entire industries. It's the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspire the innovation that runs through everything we do from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple and help us leave the world better than we found it. We're growing and urge you to apply. We believe the role would place you in a highly energized environment with some of the most talented creative individuals in the industry where you would be inspired to share your years of experience along with providing extraordinary support for the team. Job Summary Come be a part of one of the fastest-growing businesses at Apple. Apple's Internet Software & Services team is seeking an experienced, thoughtful, and entrepreneurial individual with a passion for media and entertainment to help massively grow its services business including Apple Music. You will be supporting the IS&S team's global growth efforts with a focus on managing strategic partners. Passion, energy, and drive. Extraordinary business development and partnership management track record. Strong command of business and financial modeling. Project management activities for integrating partners into Apple's services platform. Manage the ongoing commercial relationships with partners including reporting and analysis. title: Business Analyst II, Global Mile
description: Description Amazon is seeking a motivated candidate to create analyses and mechanisms that provide actionable insights regarding customer behavior and sales performance. The successful candidate will be a trusted advisor to Global Mile sales leaders across the US & EMEA. Their insights and recommendations will help sales leaders understand and bridge performance, as well as influence strategy, including new product's go-to-market, customer prioritization, etc. About Global Mile: Amazon is committed to supporting businesses in becoming successful Selling Partners. Fulfillment By Amazon (FBA) provides sellers with fulfillment services to store products in Amazon's fulfillment centers. Amazon will pick, pack, ship, and provide customer service to enable FBA sellers to scale their business and reach more customers. With Amazon’s advanced fulfillment networks, this enables "You sell it, we ship it." Often, Selling Partners may procure inventory from overseas origins, such as China, South-East Asia, requiring them to independently navigate the complexity of international freight forwarding, shipping, and customs clearance. The Global Mile team solves this Selling Partner pain-point by offering Amazon Global Logistics solutions, with a full suite of international shipping, customs clearance and storage solutions. As a Business Analyst, you will serve as the subject matter expert on presenting data in an informative and actionable way, facilitating productive, cross-functional dialogue. Your detailed analysis will inform decisions on investments, opportunities, and performance. You will collaborate with our centralized Business Intelligence and Data Engineering team to leverage existing data and build access to new data needed to inform business decisions. You will build analytical models, size opportunities, prioritize for ROI, implement techniques to process large data sets, apply statistical testing methods, address quantitative problems, build dashboards that enable leaders to better understand their business data, assess functional business performance, and develop targeted, scalable action plans. As an experienced data expert, you will be responsible for supporting and advising team peers who lead functional strategies. You will be responsible for designing and implementing tangible insights, business metrics, measurement systems that guide operations, projects, and programs roadmaps. You will have an opportunity to publish findings, updates, and data-driven recommendations to Senior Leadership. Key job responsibilities Be the subject matter expert leading the design and execution of business analytics. Build data visualization reports and tools for self-service data consumption. Analyze and extract relevant information from large amounts of structured and unstructured data to help automate and optimize key processes. Define the business problem and solution approach autonomously to prioritize business growth opportunities and maximize return on effort, while reducing lead times from concept to launch. Analyze and validate data to ensure high data quality and reliable insights. Collaborate with data engineering teams to improve data assets, quality metrics, and insights. Proactively identify areas of opportunity for in-depth investigations and future program development. Serve as the primary data and analysis expert supporting a team of 30+ individuals, creating an intake and prioritization process to balance fast-turnaround business needs with regular processes and longer-term strategic projects. Write concise documents to communicate results to stakeholders and visually represent data to facilitate decision making. A day in the life Amazon offers a full range of benefits that support you and eligible family members, including domestic partners and their children. Benefits can vary by location, the number of regularly scheduled hours you work, length of employment, and job status such as seasonal or temporary employment. The benefits that generally apply to regular, full-time employees include: Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage Maternity and Parental Leave Options Paid Time Off (PTO) 401(k) Plan Learn more about our benefits here: https://www.amazon.jobs/en/internal/benefits/us-benefits-and-stock About The Team The US EMEA Sales Planning team was created in late 2022 to support the growth of Global Mile sales and marketing teams. Our objective is to establish and iterate on strategic and tactical planning processes to help achieve business goals, maximize efficiency and ROI. We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations: Bellevue, WA, USA | Long Beach, CA, USA | New York, NY, USA Basic Qualifications Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, business, economics, engineering , analytics, mathematics, statistics or a related technical or quantitative field 2+ years of business analyst, data analyst or similar role experience Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights Experience in Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.) and data visualization tools such as Tableau Experience with SQL Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools Preferred Qualifications Master's degree in supply chain management, operations, engineering, analytics, or a related field. Experience in supply chain, logistics, e-commerce, retail Ability to apply statistical techniques and facilitate market research (e.g., hypothesis testing, control groups, benchmarking studies) 5+ years of experience working in web analytics – e.g., funnel progression, visitor behavior, conversion analysis, marketing campaign optimization, click-through rates 5+ years of experience owning the creation and regular circulation of business reports High level of competence and skill set in a variety of business analysis, e.g., trend analysis, segmentation analysis, cost-benefit analysis, scenario analysis, CLTV analysis, financial analysis, survey analysis, ROI analysis, opportunity sizing, conjoint analysis, sales forecasting, etc. Experience in project management and business process improvement If you are not sure that every qualification on the list above describes you exactly, we'd still love to hear from you! At Amazon, we value people with unique backgrounds, experiences, and skillsets. If you’re passionate about this role and want to make an impact on a global scale, please apply! Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us. Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $59,500/year in our lowest geographic market up to $143,100/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site. Company - Amazon.com Services LLC Job ID: A2648965

title: Senior Business Analyst
description: Academia.edu is a venture-backed, for-profit business based in San Francisco. Our mission is to accelerate the world's research, and we have spent the last 14 years building the largest online network for sharing and finding academic research and connecting with other academics around the world. With over 250MM users and nearly half of the world's academics using our platform every month, we are well positioned to achieve our mission. About The Role We value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds and experiences. Senior Business Analysts at Academia.edu unearth large growth opportunities by analyzing our trove of data, and help product teams deliver value to users and growth for the business. Each team includes a dedicated product manager, product designer, engineers and user researchers, and each team owns a single product or initiative. We rotate teams every 6-12 months to keep the work engaging and the ideas flowing. As an embedded member of a cross-functional product team, you would solve problems like improving the slow-moving academic publishing market, or connecting academics with others around the world to share and collaborate on ideas. As a Senior Business Analyst your analytic superpowers will thrive here. If you’re excited to use data to identify opportunities, analyze and interpret test results to identify business growth opportunities, conceive ideas to realize those opportunities, and make recommendations to product teams and executive management, then apply now! We look forward to meeting you! Please note that this role is in the San Francisco Bay Area. We're excited to have a packed and lively office on Tuesdays and Thursdays. Twice a week those of us in the Bay Area come to our office located in the Financial District for All Hands, intense collaboration, brainstorming activities, and fun events. There are small rooms for 1-1 mentoring sessions or heads down work, and larger rooms for team activities. We continue to support a flexible work environment for all of life’s surprises and needs with generous time off and flexible work schedules. Academia is a proud equal-opportunity employer and we are committed to hiring and supporting a diverse workforce. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. How You’ll Contribute Proactively find opportunities for business growth, development, and scaling, identifying opportunities for the product team and the business Gather, analyze, and interpret data to inform product strategy and product roadmap Define key metrics, design and maintain dashboards, and lead business reporting for your cross-functional product team Design and interpret results of experiments The skills and experiences you bring to succeed (absolute requirements): 2 years minimum experience consulting with one of the following firms: Bain & Company, McKinsey, BCG, Oliver Wyman, LEK. At this time we cannot interview candidates who do not meet this requirement 1 year minimum additional experience post consulting, with a B2C digital product in growth, strategy, operations, or analytics Experience applying critical thinking to business needs and problems, and identifying opportunities Experience with Excel or Google Sheets for analysis and reporting Strong cross-functional communication skills, including a proven ability to influence decision making Ability to autonomously seek information, gather resources, and deliver results without waiting for direction A work style oriented around results and creating impact The Tools You’ll Use To Succeed Don’t know the following tools? If you bring the knowledge of how to solve business problems, we’re happy to teach you the technical skills. Knowledge of SQL and databases (we use Redshift) with the ability to write structured and efficient queries on large data sets Python or R skills is a strong plus, but not necessary to apply Mode for dashboarding and DBT for data transformations or similar tools also a plus, but not necessary to apply Benefits And Perks Competitive salary, stock options & 401k Fully-covered medical, dental, & vision insurance for employees & dependents Flexible hours, 21 days of paid vacation, 12 paid company holidays, and paid parental leave Budget for professional development, team building, and books Six weeks of fully-paid sabbatical leave for every four years you work here. $175,000 - $215,000 a year

title: Business Consultant/Analyst
description: Business Consultant/Analyst - Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) HuLoop Automation is at the forefront of transforming the Global Work Intelligence Software Market with our radically simple, fast, and affordable software platform. We’re on a mission to democratize access to powerful AI-based, visual no-code process and test automation capabilities for businesses of all sizes and their non-technical users. Imagine being part of a team that helps companies by boosting productivity by 20-25% and slashing cycle time by 30-40%. At HuLoop, we liberate humans for more meaningful work while delivering a staggering 20x ROI. Forget the complex, expensive, and slow solutions offered by traditional Robotic Process Automation providers. HuLoop is what’s next. We disrupt the old paradigm with a unified automation platform that leverages Intelligent Agents and pre-built, industry-specific automations for rapid implementation. What sets us apart? Our unique Human-in-the-Loop approach harmonizes how people interact with their digital workforce of intelligent agents across critical areas of the customer’s business. We’re laser-focused on empowering financial services (banks, credit unions, collections) and consumer commerce (retail, wholesale, CPG) companies. These sectors are underserved, and urgently in need of intelligent automation, and we’re leading the charge. Join us as we revolutionize the way businesses operate and make an impact on a global scale. At HuLoop Automation, the future of work is here, and we want you to be a part of it. Apply now and let’s shape the future together! Job Location: Sacramento, California area (preferred) Job Type: Full Time, Permanent Compensation: Base salary plus bonus Job Description: As a Business Consultant/Analyst for our Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) company, you will play a pivotal role in helping our clients leverage our SaaS platform to achieve their business objectives. You will work closely with clients to understand their unique needs, analyze their business processes, and provide strategic guidance and solutions to drive value and maximize ROI. This is a dynamic and client-facing role that requires a combination of business acumen, analytical skills, and a deep understanding of SaaS technology. Job Responsibilities: Client Engagement and Requirements Gathering: Engage with clients to understand their business goals, challenges, and requirements. Conduct workshops, interviews, and discovery sessions to gather and document requirements and processes. Collaborate with clients to define project scope, objectives, and success criteria, ensuring alignment with business goals and priorities. Business Analysis and Process Improvement: Analyze client business processes and workflows to identify inefficiencies and opportunities for improvement. Develop business cases, cost-benefit analyses, and ROI calculations to quantify the value of solutions. Recommend process improvements and workflow optimizations to drive efficiency and productivity. Solution Design and Implementation: Work with cross-functional teams to design customized solutions and configurations of our SaaS platform to meet client requirements. Develop functional specifications, user stories, and acceptance criteria to guide the development and implementation process. Provide ongoing support and guidance to clients throughout the implementation process, ensuring successful adoption and integration of the SaaS platform into their operations. Data Analysis and Reporting: Collect, analyze, and interpret data to provide insights and recommendations to clients on business performance, trends, and opportunities. Develop dashboards, reports, and KPIs to track key metrics and measure the impact of our SaaS platform on client business objectives. Collaborate with clients to establish data-driven decision-making processes and leverage data analytics to drive continuous improvement. Client Relationship Management: Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, acting as a trusted advisor and advocate for their business. Serve as the primary point of contact for client inquiries, escalations, and feedback, ensuring timely and effective resolution of issues. Proactively identify opportunities for upselling, cross-selling, and expanding our services to meet evolving client needs and objectives. Job Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in business, Management, Economics, or related field (or equivalent experience). Proven experience in business consulting, business analysis, or a related role. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to gather, analyze, and interpret complex info. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to build rapport, influence stakeholders, and present ideas. Experience with SaaS platforms, CRM systems, or other business software solutions is preferred. Familiarity with project management methodologies (e.g., Agile, Scrum) and tools (e.g., JIRA, Asana) is a plus. Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, managing multiple projects and priorities simultaneously. Reports To: TBD Equal Employment Opportunity Company: HuLoop is an Equal Employment Opportunity company that offers an excellent benefit package that includes Medical, Dental, and Vision. The company also offers paid vacation, holidays, and sick time. Potential candidates must be authorized to work in the United States. #J-18808-Ljbffr
