title: Business Analyst
description: 601 Hawaii St, El Segundo, California, 90245-4814, United States of America GENERAL PURPOSE OF THE JOB: This position is responsible for leading complex analyses, solving ambiguous problems, and making decisions to improve processes in order to drive strategic improvements across one or more of the business teams within Revenue Operations. ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: Analysis & Technical: Leads complex analysis by aggregating data across multiple data sources utilizing advanced skills in analytics tools such as Excel, SQL and Tableau. Continuously learns new technical capabilities & recommends how they can be leveraged. Subject matter expert for where and how to get data across multiple databases. Evaluates the business impact of various efforts by building complex analytical models & determining variable assumptions. Acts as a team resource for troubleshooting issues and QC’ing errors Problem Solving: Solves complex & ambiguous problems by breaking down key drivers and developing a robust problem-solving approach (ex. Identifies issues, recommends solutions & designs approaches for how updates across multiple interrelated systems can solve a business need; changes processes that impact work and prioritization across multiple teams, etc.). Understands how metrics & processes across multiple businesses are interrelated and the implications of overall work on broader business objectives. Goes beyond the initial analytical ask or problem to be solved based on initial findings. Synthesizes key takeaways from an analysis, presents recommended actions, gains alignment & drives results by influencing change; viewed as team expert & recommends to others how to best visualize analysis results. Project & Stakeholder management: Effectively leads working sessions across multiple stakeholders. Mentors others on building collaborative relationships with key stakeholders. Directs & executes on next steps for projects for which they are responsible. Time is prioritized according to value & business need. Mentorship: Starts to provide direction and helps with others’ work; viewed as a mentor and expert across the team. EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE: 6 to 8 years of relevant experience – Required. Bachelor’s Degree – Required. SPECIALIZED EXPERIENCE, EDUCATION, TRAINING, OR QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor’s degree in a related field of study OR applicable work experience -Required. Master’s degree – Preferred. Strong quantitative and problem-solving skills, including complex analytical modeling & insight generation – Required. Ability to communicate complex ideas in a simple, easily digestible manner to a range of audiences – Preferred. Commitment to DaVita’s Core Values – Required. Experience in healthcare and/or revenue cycle – Preferred. TRAVEL AND TIME REQUIREMENTS: Travel: 5% - 10%. At DaVita, we strive to be a community first and a company second. We want all teammates to experience DaVita as "a place where I belong." Our goal is to embed Diversity & Belonging into everything we do in our Village, so that it becomes part of who we are. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. As such, individuals are recruited, hired, assigned and promoted without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or any other protected characteristic. Applications are accepted on an ongoing basis. Salary/ Wage Range $55,000.00 - $91,000.00 / year Compensation for the role will depend on a number of factors, including a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies and experience and may fall outside of the range shown. DaVita offers a competitive total rewards package, which includes a 401k match, healthcare coverage and a broad range of other benefits. Learn more at https://careers.davita.com/benefits

title: DeFi strategy & operations analyst
description: About ABC Labs: We believe access to stable money is a human right. Almost two billion people around the world don't have a safe place to store their money or are excluded from financial services such as payments and credit. Struggles with inflationary currencies prevent families and communities from building basic economic security. To help solve this, we created the Reserve Protocol, a free, permissionless platform on the Ethereum mainnet and Base L2 to build, deploy and govern asset-backed currencies referred to as "RTokens." RTokens are always 1:1 asset-backed, allowing for permissionless minting and redeeming on-chain by users without the need for any middlemen. RTokens are over-collateralized and by default governed independently by RSR stakers in a fully decentralized manner. We are actively expanding to new verticals and regions, and would love to explore if you could be a fit for our team! More information on our mission and the people behind it can be found here . Summary: We are looking for an analyst who can support the development, implementation, and execution of a comprehensive DeFi incentives strategy as well as the accompanying token operations and reporting infrastructure. The ideal candidate is extremely detail oriented, interested/passionate about DeFi, and well versed in performing analyses using tools like SQL and Excel. SF Bay Area preferred, willing to consider remote in United States. Responsibilities: Support Token Operations for ABC Labs to facilitate onchain DeFi activity Oversee tracking and reporting of token incentives to analyze and measure KPIs for Reserve and ABC Labs Identify possible ways to automate or streamline tracking/reporting processes for increased efficiency around the organization Work closely with DeFi Incentives Lead to develop strategies to improve incentive efficiency and increase RToken TVL and adoption Defi Performance Marketing Strategy - Learn about various DeFi protocols, monitor CAC and determine if it makes economic sense given our LTV and payback period. title: 10457 - Sr. Business Process Analyst
description: Purpose: The Sr. BPA (Business Process Analyst) is responsible for creating detailed requirements specifications for Connected Car development including new features and enhancements such as core platform and customer channels like web portal and mobile app. This includes coordinating with business, engineering, and multiple stakeholders to elicit, analyze, and define product and system requirements, create a high-level system design, and interface specifications with the help of a Solution Architect. Works on problems of diverse scope where analysis of data requires evaluation of identifiable factors. Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice. title: Senior Digital Business Analyst
description: WHY JOIN ALO? Mindful movement. It’s at the core of why we do what we do at Alo—it’s our calling. Because mindful movement in the studio leads to better living. It changes who yogis are off the mat, making their lives and their communities better. That’s the real meaning of studio-to-street: taking the consciousness from practice on the mat and putting it into practice in life. OVERVIEW We are seeking a Senior Digital Business Analyst with experience in retail marketing and merchandising, and a passion for data-driven, repeatable, and rigorous analytics. The ideal candidate has a deep appreciation for the e-commerce landscape and understands that style and statistics go hand-in-hand. You’ll build actionable insights by studying user engagement/behavior and publishing your findings to real-time data dashboards; you’ll put those insights to work by collaborating with our Marketing, Product, Merchandising, and Data groups to design and launch experiments; and you’ll keep us agile by developing new metrics and custom reporting. If you’re an experienced analyst, with expertise in the e-commerce space and a desire to do impactful, visible work, we look forward to hearing from you. You’re comfortable building reports from the ground up for new features & AB tests. You are familiar with various e-commerce platforms such as Shopify and are a self-motivated learner when it comes to exploring new data visualization tools such as heap or datastudio. Your goal is to discover performance opportunities within the shopping funnel (navigation-plp-pdp-cart-checkout) and communicate your insights to the business, thereby influencing the strategic product roadmap. RESPONSIBILITIES Monitor site funnel metrics to discover traffic trends, click-through patterns, customer engagement, product performance, and purchasing patterns Design, develop, and maintain reporting dashboards to tie those funnel metrics to Alo’s strategic business goals, so that key trends are recognized and acted upon quickly Investigate product performance from a merchandise hierarchy perspective, in order to plan monthly merchandising category targets and to identify cross-sell/upsell opportunities Collaboratively design and execute statistically-powered A/B tests with tools like Optimizely and Heap Monitor, measure, and define metrics measuring business KPIs including AOV across the funnel Associate new features and products with conversion and retention-based metrics Address ad-hoc requests according to SLAs Document and share your work, and contribute to a culture of data rigor QUALIFICATIONS Minimum 6+ years Professional Experience in Retail or eCommerce Analytics/Business Intelligence Proficient in reconciling and reporting on data from many sources, including Shopify, Redshift, Heap, and FDM4 Experience with Python, Heap, Tableau, GA or similar tools to transform and visualize data. Strong verbal, written, & presentation skills, with ability to communicate advanced analytics to non-technical executives & cross-functional stakeholders. The base salary range for this position is $120,000- $150,000 per year which represents the current range for the base salary for this exempt position. Please note that actual salaries will vary based on factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. As such, on occasion and when applicable, there is the possibility that the final, agreed-upon base salary may be outside of the upper end of the range. Please also note the range listed is just one component of the company’s total rewards package for exempt employees. Other rewards may include performance bonuses, long term incentives, a PTO policy, and many other progressive benefits. Please review our company California Job Applicant Privacy Policy HERE.

Proficient with MS Office Suite Excellent written and oral communications skills Self-starter, willing to get involved and do whatever is needed to get the job done. title: Business Management Analyst
description: Requisition ID: R10162407 Category: Business Management Location: Sunnyvale, California, United States of America Clearance Type: None Telecommute: Yes- May Consider Full Time Teleworking for this position Shift: 1st Shift (United States of America) Travel Required: Yes, 10% of the Time Relocation Assistance: Relocation assistance may be available Positions Available: 1 At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history. At the heart of Defining Possible is our commitment to missions. In rapidly changing global security environments, Northrop Grumman brings informed insights and software-secure technology to enable strategic planning. We’re looking for innovators who can help us keep building on our wide portfolio of secure, affordable, integrated, and multi-domain systems and technologies that fuel those missions. By joining in our shared mission, we’ll support yours of expanding your personal network and developing skills, whether you are new to the field, or an industry thought leader. At Northrop Grumman, you’ll have the resources, support, and team to do some of the best work of your career. We are looking for you to join our team as a Business Management Analyst in hybrid position based out of Sunnyvale, CA . Level 2 Business Management Analyst What You’ll Get To Do The Business Management Analyst will interface with Program Managers, Control Account Managers (CAM), and Business Managers to provide financial analysis on program performance. As part of this role the selected candidate will analyze cost data to prepare program financial reports for internal and external customers relative to program cost incurrence, material tracking and labor expenses to help ensure program contracts perform within negotiated parameters. This role will work cooperatively with business, functional, and technical staff to support cost estimate development, invoicing, customer proposals, negotiations, and various audits. This role will forecast financial statements (Income Statement and Balance Sheet), the Annual Operating Plan (AOP), and the Labor Resource Plan for their program. The Business Management Analyst supports identification and mitigation of program cost and schedule risks. The Business Management Analyst will also perform Earned Value Management (EVM) tasks including developing the performance measurement baseline (PMB), forecasting the Estimate at Complete (EAC), controlling change management processes and preparing internal and external status reports. Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration (Accounting, Data Analytics, Economics, Finance, Management, Marketing, etc.) or Business adjacent degree (Mathematics, Risk Management) from an accredited institution from an accredited institution with a minimum of 3 years of financial work experience OR a Master Degree in Business Administration (Accounting, Data Analytics, Economics, Finance, Management, Marketing, etc.) or Business adjacent degree (Mathematics, Risk Management) from an accredited institution from an accredited institution with a minimum of 1 years of financial work experience. Basic understanding of Government Compliance. 3+ years of financial work experience is Mandatory for all direct hire roles. 3+ year experience in strong data mining and database management. Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, lookups, chart generation, VBA macros, etc.) Willingness and ability to travel domestically up to 10%. Able to obtain and maintain and active DoD security clearance. Current US Citizenship Required Preferred Qualifications SAP, COGNOS, or similar ERP software experience Professional experience in Aerospace & Defense, Financial Services, or Telecommunications. Earned Value Management (EVM) customer reporting, COBRA experience. What We Can Offer You Northrop Grumman provides a comprehensive benefits package and a work environment which encourages your growth and supports the mutual success of our people and our company. Northrop Grumman benefits give you the flexibility and control to choose the benefits that make the most sense for you and your family. Your benefits will include the following: Health Plan, Savings Plan, Paid Time Off and Additional Benefits including Education Assistance, Training and Development, 9/80 Work Schedule (where available), and much more! Salary Range: $1 - $2 The above salary range represents a general guideline; however, Northrop Grumman considers a number of factors when determining base salary offers such as the scope and responsibilities of the position and the candidate's experience, education, skills and current market conditions. Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business. The application period for the job is estimated to be 20 days from the job posting date. However, this timeline may be shortened or extended depending on business needs and the availability of qualified candidates. Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. title: Principal Business Analyst
description: About Us Matson has been the leading ocean shipping and logistics provider throughout the Pacific since 1882. We are the supply chain lifeline for Hawaii, Alaska, Guam, and islands of the South Pacific. We also offer the top two ocean shipping services in the world’s largest trade lane - Asia to the U.S. West Coast. With our subsidiaries Matson Terminals and Matson Logistics, our business focus is exceeding customer expectations with quality, reliability, and integrity. We strive to operate in an environmentally sustainable manner and promote land-based environmental programs in Hawaii, Guam, and Alaska. We help improve the communities in which we work and live through our community giving program that annually supports hundreds of local organizations. And we work to improve diversity, equity and inclusion in our company, communities and industry through an active social equity program. Matson is a great place to work, and everyone who works with us becomes part of the Matson ohana or family. Join our team and help us move freight better than anyone. Learn more at matson.com. About The Role We are seeking a Principal Business Analyst to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for understanding and modifying business processes, gathering system requirements, writing system requirements, and looking at data for patterns. They will also be responsible for testing software applications and systems to improve business processes. What you’ll do: Analyze current business processes and make recommendations for improvement based on industry trends and professional business knowledge. Improve training and operational procedures within a business to increase efficiency and productivity. Work directly with clients to understand the individual needs of the business. Use a variety of data analysis and organization tools to discover the most impactful insights. Develop project goals, phases, and budgets. Establish specifications for new projects. Gather requirements from stakeholders. Communicate with key stakeholders. Schedule projects and run meetings. Test and integrate distributed cloud applications. You have these skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Good written and verbal communication skills. Understanding of agile, scrum, and water-fall methods of development. Use QA test tools like Mercury to ensure software quality. Use documentation tools like Word, Visio, and PowerPoint to create technical documents. Working knowledge of Python, C, or Java. Use SQL skills to create ad hoc queries including building data models for proof-of-concept applications. Good understanding of cloud computing, client server architecture and systems. And these qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field. Seven or more years of experience in a technical role. The annual salary range for this position in California is $111,300 - $151,500. The salary offered will depend upon qualifications and other operational considerations. At Matson, we're looking for people to build a unified team to maintain our values of trust, integrity, and reliability. We welcome diverse perspectives and people who think rigorously and thoughtfully challenge assumptions. #MI

title: Business Analyst (SAP QM)
description: Applied Medical is a new generation medical device company with a proven business model and commitment to innovation fueled by rapid business growth and expansion. Our company has been developing and manufacturing advanced surgical technologies for over 35 years and has earned a strong reputation for excellence in the healthcare field. Our unique business model, combined with our dedication to delivering the highest quality products, enables team members to contribute in a larger capacity than is possible in typical positions. Position Description The SAP QM Business Analyst (BA) provides business process analysis and SAP configuration expertise to identify problems and realize opportunities for improvement to Applied Medical’s business operations. The BA supports Applied Medical’s internal customers by maintaining and expanding the functionality of SAP in the Quality Management module. As an SAP QM Business Analyst, you will be responsible for working within the framework of a team and performing the following activities during the designated periods: Performance Objectives: Within your first 30 - 60 days: Learn and familiarize yourself with departmental and business processes and relevant software technologies. Participate in the development and implementation and new systems and solutions. Engage with internal customers and various business functions, particularly Quality Systems, Regulatory, and Quality Control teams. Understand customers’ needs and identify opportunities to automate processes related to Quality Management. Within your first 60 - 90 days and beyond: Design prototype solutions or mockups for Applied’s SAP ERP system with a focus on Quality Management. Research, evaluate, and implement new business technology solutions. Manage projects of varying size and scope with minimal direction including project planning and execution. Deliver portfolio of approved system projects and deliverables on time, with expected quality and value added. Ongoing support and maintain existing SAP enterprise systems, focusing on SAP QM. Collaborate with global team members to ensure successful completion of requests. Continuously acquire knowledge and skills in enterprise scale application design, development, and implementation of systems, such as SAP and web applications. Analyze existing business processes and recommend improvements aligned with Quality Management best practices. Provide subject matter expertise as the functional owner of SAP QM. Resolve issues and requests related to SAP QM accurately and in a timely manner. Coordinate end-user training documentation and ensure effective system understanding related to Quality Management. Participate in software validation activities to ensure that software solutions are designed to specifications and for intended use. Manage software-related projects and ensure that business solutions are designed, developed, and implemented according to the business needs. Position Requirements This position requires the following skills and attributes: Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science or related technical field. More than five years in an Information Technology related field. Minimum eight years SAP QM Experience. Hands-on experience in full cycle implementation of SAP QM. Excellent problem-solving skills. Exceptional interpersonal and team collaboration skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Attention to detail. Familiarity with SAP’s ecosystem of solutions and solutions providers. Ability to guide business decisions on functionality, software selection, and vendor selection. Experience in configuring and using SAP Quality Management System. Clear understanding of Catalogs, Notifications, Inspection Plans, and Master Inspection Characteristics. Expertise in managing requirements and practicing effective scope management. Preferred The following skills and attributes are preferred: Cross-functional knowledge of: Plant Maintenance (PM). Production and Planning (PP). Logistics (LE). Sales and Distribution (SD). Service Management (SM). Benefits Competitive compensation range: $95000 - $150000 / year (California). Comprehensive benefits package. Training and mentorship opportunities. On-campus wellness activities. Education reimbursement program. 401(k) program with discretionary employer match. Generous vacation accrual and paid holiday schedule. Please note that the compensation range may be adjusted in the future, and bonus and incentive compensation plans may apply. Our total reward package reflects our commitment to employee growth and well-being, as we invest in your development and offer a range of benefits designed to enhance your career and life. All compensation and benefits are subject to plan documents and written agreements. Equal Opportunity Employer Applied Medical is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, disability (mental and physical), exercising the right to family care and medical leave, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, military or veteran status, national origin, political affiliation, race, religious creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding and related medical conditions), or sexual orientation, or any other status protected by federal, state or local laws in the locations where Applied Medical operates.

title: Senior Business Analyst (Hybrid)
description: About This Role The Senior Business Analyst gathers, analyzes, and documents business requirements, as well as facilitates communication between business stakeholders and technical teams. Drives successful outcomes for projects and initiatives using analytical skills, business acumen, and effective communication. Demonstrates behavior that is consistent with the company’s values of Customer Satisfaction, Innovation, Family, and Social Responsibility. Essential Job Functions/Tasks Collaborates with business stakeholders to elicit, analyze, and document business requirements for IT projects and initiatives. Conducts interviews, workshops, and analysis sessions to understand business processes, identify pain points, and define user needs. Translates business requirements into clear and actionable specifications, including functional and non-functional requirements, use cases, and user stories. Facilitates meetings and workshops with stakeholders to gather requirements, provide updates, and solicit feedback on proposed solutions. Builds and maintains strong relationships with stakeholders at all levels of the organization, earning trust and credibility as a trusted advisor. Collaborates with solution architects, developers, and other stakeholders to design and validate proposed solutions that meet business requirements. Participates in solution reviews, prototype demonstrations, and user acceptance testing to ensure alignment with business needs and objectives. Provides input and recommendations on solution alternatives, considering feasibility, cost, and impact on business processes. Creates clear and comprehensive documentation of business requirements, including business process diagrams, requirements specifications, and user documentation. Communicates effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders, translating complex concepts into understandable terms. Prepares and delivers presentations, reports, and status updates to project teams, steering committees, and executive leadership as needed. Stays abreast of industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies related to business analysis and IT project management. Identifies opportunities for process improvements, standardization, and automation to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of business analysis practices. Provides mentorship and cross training to other members of the team. Preferred Required Education/Training Required and Preferred: Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Information Technology, or related field; master’s degree preferred. Experience Required And Preferred Minimum of 5 years of experience as a Business Analyst, with a focus on gathering and documenting business requirements for IT projects. What You Bring Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to critically evaluate information and propose creative solutions. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport and effectively communicate with diverse stakeholders. Proficiency in business analysis techniques and methodologies, such as process modeling, requirements elicitation, and stakeholder management. Experience with Agile and/or Waterfall project management methodologies, including participation in Agile ceremonies such as sprint planning and retrospectives. Familiarity with business process management (BPM) tools and techniques, as well as requirements management tools. Proven ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment, managing multiple priorities and deadlines effectively. What We Offer Amazing corporate culture - we walk the walk when it comes to our values! Beautiful 20 acre park like campus with creek and walking trails On site wellness center with personal training, fitness classes and massage FUN company events! Company Donation Matching and Volunteer Rewards Career Development opportunities and profit sharing bonus Follow us on LinkedIn, check out our rave reviews on Glassdoor, and learn more about our company culture on our career site: http://corporate.hunterindustries.com/careers Hunter is a global leader in the irrigation, outdoor lighting, dispensing technology, and custom manufacturing industries. Driving our continued success is the combined energy and talents of the nearly 4,000 people on our team. Together, we create a diverse array of products that can be seen all over the world, from residential landscapes to national landmarks, stadiums, parks, hotels, and municipal buildings. Hunter Industries and its Family of Companies is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, military and veteran status, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, or any other applicable legally protected status or characteristic. The salary for this opportunity ranges from $90,380 to $129,870 The Company complies with all federal/local/state regulations in regard to pay. The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Compensation offered to the successful candidate will be determined by qualifications, prior experience, other job-related factors, and geographic location.

Own coordination, timeline planning, cross-functional meetings and follow-ups to ensure successful delivery of a complex execution space Effectively manage schedule to regularly attend meetings and deliver on accountable work Design framework & processes to facilitate cross team collaboration Provide support across multiple projects to ensure high-quality releases Produce qualitative and quantitative reporting to stakeholders Research new vendors within Trust Product domains Soft Skills Detail-oriented, highly organized and able to multitask Dynamic and very adaptable to a fast-paced changing environment Able to balance multiple conflicting priorities and negotiate trade-offs Communication skills - able to explain complex concepts both verbally and via written communications, including technical concepts Flexible and adaptable to change Excellent interpersonal skills (influence, empathy, clarity in communication) Focused on learning, growing and developing new skill-sets Hard Skills Proficiency in Google Suite (Gmail, Calendar, Sheets, Slides, etc) Familiarity with the Identity, Safety and Fraud Management methodologies a plus Type Of Experience 4+ years experience being a Partnerships/Vendor and/or Program Manager; driving/leading medium to large cross-functional efforts; (driving execution, creating strategic plans and communicating with business stakeholders) [Nice to have] Experience working in start-up or fast paced, do-it-yourself environment [Nice to have] Some experience in Trust, Privacy, Safety, Identity or Fraud Pay Rate Range $53-57.24/hr. title: Business Analyst, Supply Chain
description: Shipping Analyst ANINE BING is looking for a Shipping Analyst to join its Strategic Finance team based in Los Angeles. The Shipping Analyst will spearhead projects from inception to implementation turning data into actionable insights in order to enhance profitability at ANINE BING. The ideal candidate has extensive knowledge of inbound and outbound logistics and experience working with large data sets. This person is driven, detail-oriented, and works collaboratively with Finance, Operations, and business partners across the organization. An analytical, curious, and open-minded approach to problem-solving are essential to thrive in this role. This role can be remote or hybrid in our Los Angeles HQ, and will report to the Senior Director, Strategic Finance. Responsibilities Include Develop financial models related to inbound and outbound shipping to optimize cost, transit times, and service levels Collaborate cross-functionally and with 3PLs to aggregate and dissect data from various departments and sources to conduct comprehensive service level, cost, and transit analysis at both aggregate and unit levels Create a sophisticated shipping model to assess areas of need, gaps in service offerings, and potential impacts of contract changes on shipping operations. Identify areas of improvement for inbound and outbound shipping across transit lanes, freight, duties, accessorials, etc., proposing actionable solutions to enhance efficiency and reduce costs. Develop, monitor, and analyze performance dashboards and reports related to transportation and shipping logistics, providing regular reports and insights to stakeholders. Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in shipping logistics to drive continuous improvement initiatives. Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Logistics, Supply Chain Management, or a related field. Advanced degree preferred. Minimum of 5 years of experience in related logistics activities such as freight rates, freight bill auditing, and carrier-related activities (sea/air/land). Strong working knowledge of SQL for data analysis and advanced skills in MS Office: Excel, Access (creating tables, forms, queries, macros), and PowerPoint. Strong analytical skills with the ability to gather, analyze, and interpret large datasets to drive decision-making. Excellent oral and written communication skills, including the ability to present complex data-driven insights to stakeholders. Benefits & Perks Work/Life Balance: Flexible work schedules, Unlimited/ flexible time off, paid holidays throughout the year, and extra days off in the summer Wellness: ANINE BING covers 75% of costs for your medical, dental, and vision insurance and offers an array of other benefits for you and your dependents, including a generous parental leave program And more: Generous employee discount and wardrobe Compensation The anticipated base salary range for this role is $80,000 - $110,000 Working at ANINE BING ANINE BING seeks to empower its employees by providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Diversity and inclusion is critical to our success as a global brand, and we seek to recruit, develop, and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. More About ANINE BING ANINE BING is a Los Angeles-based fashion house started in 2012 that blends elements of Scandinavian simplicity with American energy to offer modern wardrobe essentials for women seeking a timeless yet rebellious approach to everyday style. Since its launch, ANINE BING has built a global brand represented across 90+ countries, including brick-and-mortar retail stores in cities worldwide. Headquartered in Los Angeles, ANINE BING has over 200 employees and is backed by key investors, which include Index Ventures founder Danny Rimer (Facebook, Dropbox, Roblox, Net-A-Porter), Greycroft Partners founder Dana Settle (Bumble, Cuyana, Farfetch), and Felix Capital founder Frederic Court (Goop, Farfetch, Vitrue, Dailymotion).

title: Business Analyst - Appeals & Grievances
description: Position will mainly be remote. Only will be going into the office once a quarter for onsite meeting. There is HR Policy that person must be living in California while working remote and ideally local/driving distance to Los Angeles. Job Summary The Business Analyst III facilitates business process improvement via the methodical investigation, analysis, review and documentation of functional business specifications. This position manages the requirements development process through the elicitation, analysis, specification and verification of multiple levels of requirements from an end-to-end perspective and supports the ongoing management of the requirements. This position will develop report and analysis for the department. It is responsible in communicating and coordinating with IT on a day-to-day department related efforts. The Business Analyst III will manage and coordinate the implementation and/or integration of products or new features for clients including client training and provides subject matter expertise (SME) and support of the department's inbound and outbound functions. This position will act as mentor to Business Analysts I/ II. Duties Develop functional and user acceptance test plans and scenarios. Coordinate functional and user acceptance testing by executing the testing strategy, scheduling resources and tracking test performance. Perform data analysis to support evaluation of system defects or to develop requirements for new functionality; assist in various system trouble shooting and balancing and correction efforts including analysis, verification and validation of issues and fixes. Coordinate activities including on-time delivery, testing and production moves. Collaborate with I.T. on all department related efforts, including submission of Service Requests and writing BRD's. Coordinate related data requests from internal departments, and/or assist I.T. with definition of criteria. Delegate data and reporting requests to business analysts. Facilitate collaborative system and data design sessions with the user community, technical architecture resources and development resources. Preparation of status updates to enterprise for distribution and communication. Work as a technical support and liaison to designated I.T. personnel to provide testing, support and feedback on enhancement requests and regular updates/releases; adhere to release schedules. Provide analytical support for critical corporate initiatives including business function support for system migrations and consolidations, significant business area process improvement projects and complex product installations. Demonstrate a high level of subject matter expertise in functional area to bridge business requirements and I.T. solutions; provide technical direction and ensure compliance with best practice solutions. Practice knowledge transfer and foster change management as the organization changes and new skills are required, focusing on team/individual development to be a valued contributor. Participate and contribute on the development/ creation of data models and interface design specifications. Support internal/ external stakeholder's roadmap and audits as needed. Oversee the business process support across multiple client engagements. Communication with internal/ external stakeholders for department's submission requirements. Review submission of data against established benchmarks and coordinate correction and improvement efforts. Monitor timely and accurate outbound data submission to state and federal recipients. Bachelor's Degree In lieu of degree, equivalent education and/or experience may be considered. Experience Required: Proven analytical/technical aptitude evidenced by at least 5 years of successful experience in a quantitative role as a Business Analyst, Data Analyst, Programming Analyst, Claims processing, encounter processing. Skills Required: Competent to work at the highest technical level of most phases of systems analysis. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Coaching, Mentoring and Teaching skills. Teamwork-focused/collaborative work style. Demonstrated ability to work successfully on large projects. Problem solving skills evidenced by demonstrated results in past positions. Ability to work under tight deadlines and handle multiple/detail-oriented tasks. Ability to influence at all levels of the organization. Proficient in Microsoft Office and Vizio. Preferred Ability to work on other programs such as SharePoint and/ or OneNote 4% merit increase yearly and 4% incentive bonus paid OUTSTANDING SALARY AND BENEFITS PACKAGE !!!

title: Sr. Business Analyst
description: Join a team that is changing millions of lives. Transforming smiles, changing lives. At Align Technology, we believe a great smile can transform a person’s life, so we create technology that gives people the confidence to take on whatever’s next. We revolutionized the orthodontic industry with the introduction of the Invisalign system, and we have never lost sight of that spirit of innovation. Our diverse and collaborative teams are constantly pushing the boundaries of what’s possible. Ready to join us? About This Opportunity Looking for Sr. Business Analyst to join Global Enterprise IT team in San Jose, CA. This person shall quickly understand Align business, collect new requirements, and work with development and other teams to provide business solution. In this role, you will… Partnering with Product Management and Engineering to ensure continuous refinement of backlog, which may include stories from multiple projects. Be responsible for direct interaction with stakeholders including, but not limited to, eliciting comprehensive business requirements and use cases and recommending appropriate solutions. Accurately translates business requirements to detail-level system specifications. Deliver precise functional specifications to include functional hierarchy, workflow, business rules, interface definitions and design, and data mapping. Engage with Technical Architects and Developers on technical strategy and designs to meet the business needs. Conduct gap analysis between application and stated customer requirements and collaborate with Architects and Developers to estimate project impact. Work with Development, QA, and Production Support teams to communicate, verify, and test the desired functionality changes. Work with the stakeholders to demonstrate the changes to the system to ensure all relevant business needs are addressed. Develop training materials and provide training in one-on-one or classroom environment. Manage multiple competing priorities through effective organization and communication. Recommend and institute BA best practice and methodology and tools. Work within or across multiple project teams to ensure that blockers are resolved, and communication gaps are plugged quickly and efficiently. Ensure quality and completeness of the finished product by participating in user acceptance testing, ensuring that acceptance criteria are met. In this role, you’ll need … Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education/experience in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field with 8-12 years of experience Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to quickly understand complex issues and develop effective solutions. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with business and technical stakeholders. Experience with project management methodologies and tools, such as Agile, Scrum, or Waterfall. Experience with database management systems (e.g., PostgreSQL, Oracle) and writing basic SQLs for analysis and data modeling. Knowledge of programming languages (e.g., Java, JavaScript) is a plus. Sound like a good fit? Great! Click the "Apply" link to let us know you are interested. Not the right fit? Don’t worry, Align is quickly growing so we are creating more opportunities to expand our Align family. Please consider joining our Talent Network to receive notifications about future jobs or sharing this opportunity with others in your network. About Align Align Technology is a publicly traded medical device company that is transforming smiles and changing lives. Our global team of talented employees develop innovative technology, tools and treatment options to help dental professionals worldwide achieve the clinical results they expect. Our digital ecosystem combines the power of technology to create beautiful smiles through the integration of AI and machine learning, digital imaging and visualization, biomechanics and material science to develop the Invisalign system, the most advanced clear aligner system in the world; iTero Intraoral Scanners and OrthoCAD digital services. Did you know? Align is the world’s largest manufacturer of custom 3D-printed materials. By joining Align, you will be part of a global, fast-growing company in one of the most dynamic industries. Great people, innovative technologies, and meaningful work – these are just some of the things employees say make Align Technology a great place to work. We respect your privacy. Please review our Applicant Privacy Policies for additional information. Global Diversity Statement At Align, we believe in the power of a smile, and we know that every smile is as unique as our employees. As we grow, we will continue building a workforce of diverse cultural backgrounds and life experiences and fostering a culture of open-mindedness and compassion for all our employees. We live our company values by promoting healthy people and healthy communities. All with the intent of changing millions of lives, one unique smile at a time. Equal Opportunity Statement It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunity in all of our employment practices without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, marital status, protected veteran status, age, individuals with disabilities, sexual orientation or gender identity or expression or any other legally protected category. Applicants for positions with Align must be legally authorized to work in the country which they are applying for and verification of employment eligibility will be required as a condition of hire. Primary Location Base Salary Range: $151,100 to $178,800 USD Base salary ranges are a guideline used to determine appropriate pay. Placement depends on the individual skills and experience level of a candidate plus the total compensation and equity across team members. For other locations outside of the primary location, the base salary range will be adjusted geographically. For field Sales roles, the salary listed is the base pay only and does not include the applicable commission plan. A cost of living adjustment may be added to base pay for higher cost areas in the U.S. Our internship hourly rates are a standard pay determined based on the position and your location, year in school, degree, and experience.

title: Business Analyst, Senior
description: Top Things Lookng For Project Management understanding, Financial Modelling, forecasting understanding, and effective communication skills. Position Summary The Senior Business Analyst acts as the business expert filling a liaison role between the IT development group and business units for development, enhancement, and implementation of new and/or existing systems. Additionally this position provides data and reporting solutions to satisfy informational and performance metrics needs for one or more business functions. Responsibilities Provide expert consulting to the client, to identify and satisfy client business needs. Analyze end-to-end business processes and information needs of varying complexity, encompassing one or more Company business functional operations and potentially external entities. Understand the client's current and future business environment, effectively anticipate, identify, and fully meet all business needs. Propose, evaluate and document alternatives that will provide the most effective solution to solve business problems including delivery of new business initiatives. Anticipate client concerns and questions and provide timely, professional, and client-focused communications via meetings, status reports, phone, and email and follow through with results. Prepare communications and make presentations on system enhancements and/or alternatives. Provide client support on the effective use of production systems. Research potential system issues in transaction processing and data quality. Provide timely responses for client inquiries. Work with team members, supervisor, and client organizations as appropriate to ensure smooth system operations to minimize impact on business operations and enable the business to achieve results. Lead and/or support recovery of production system issues, including business process recovery. Define and document business requirements. Prepare functional specification documents for one or more applications or one or more system functions. Prepare business cases in support of business initiatives. Prepare technical specification documents. Prepare and/or review test plans and perform quality reviews on test results. Perform functional integration testing of transactional processing, data extracts, and reporting. Comply with SOX documentation and other standard process requirements as appropriate. Configure system parameters or soft tables to enable application functions to perform per specifications. Develop queries to extract data or create operational reports using production databases. Perform unit, string, and functional integration tests to ensure application solutions and reports satisfy defined functional and/or technical specifications. Conduct all work safely and promote safe work practices. Attend all safety meetings and training sessions. Comply with all Utility safety best practices and safety accountability model. Demonstrated participation in projects of medium to high complexity. Demonstrated leadership role in medium to high complexity projects. Expert technical knowledge of one or more functional areas in client business applications, CC&B, SAP, etc., Project Management skills sufficient to coordinate multi-organizational projects. Demonstrated excellent written and verbal communication skills. Minimum Qualifications BA/BS in Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Systems, or equivalent work experience. MBA, CPA, CMA desired. Demonstrated course work and/or training in programming languages used for client applications and proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite. 7 to 10 years of experience in similar or related job functions.

title: Business Analyst/QA Analyst
description: Business Analyst/Quality Assurance Analyst Los Angeles or Pittsburgh office - Hybrid onsite 2-3 days per week Team Description We are a small team supporting a large set of systems including numerous websites, contact management, email outreach, mobile applications, publishing systems, process management, and analytics, as well as our internal systems (CI/CD, build, monitoring, logging, etc.) that helps us keep everything running optimally. Position Summary In this role you will help define, test, launch, and manage quality digital products and systems. As a BA/QA analyst, you should be a strong problem solver who can identify and document the relevant details of system design, from requirements gathering to final product testing. This will require the ability to think critically and have a thorough understanding of the web application development process, including daily collaboration with front- and back-end developers and designers. You should be an advocate for user-centered solutions and expect to proactively lead BA/QA work throughout a project's lifecycle. BA Analyst Responsibilities Project management of team efforts. Help lead project and application planning activities including planning, scheduling, meetings, communications, and documentation. Work with key project stakeholders to analyze the feasibility of, and develop requirements for, new systems and enhancements to existing systems; ensure the system design fits the needs of the users. Identify business rules and opportunities for improving business processes. Management of SaaS systems including setup and configuration, reporting and troubleshooting. QA Analyst Responsibilities Work closely with developers, project managers, and operations team members on testing and deployment activities. Create and execute test plans/cases based on evolving project requirements. Test web applications and off the shelf applications. Identify and document application issues. Lead UAT activities including writing User Acceptance Test (UAT) cases. Lead application deployment activities. Requirements 2+ years of experience as a QA analyst, technical business analyst or technical project manager 2+ years of experience testing web-based and off the shelf software applications Strong communication skills, both written and verbal Proven ability to lead project team activities in an Agile/Scrum/Lean team environment Experience in major areas of testing cycle - gathering, documenting, and analyzing requirements, providing estimates, creating test plans/cases, creating process diagrams, logging bugs, coordinating UAT, change management, deployment support. Nice to have Basic high-level knowledge of web design and familiarity with core technologies such as Web Analytics, Search Engines, Content Management Systems, HTML, JavaScript - ability to test major application tiers (user interface, middle tier, database, back-end / infrastructure components). Experience with a variety of testing and/or development tools such as Jira, Confluence Git, Selenium, etc. Administration of Jira, Workfront, Salesforce or similar SaaS products. Familiarity with Adobe products including Creative Suite (InDesign, Photoshop), AEM and Analytics.

title: Business Analyst-II (W2 Only)
description: Job Description LeadStack Inc. is an award winning, one of the nation's fastest growing, certified minority owned (MBE) staffing services provider of contingent workforce. As a recognized industry leader in contingent workforce solutions and Certified as a Great Place to Work, we're proud to partner with some of the most admired Fortune 500 brands in the world. Title: Marketing Business Analyst-II (W2 Only) Location: Local to California (100% Remote) Duration: 6+ months Job ID: 24-00420 Rate $57- $60/hour. (DOE) About the Role We’re looking for a detail oriented, highly-motivated individual to help us execute engaging and innovative marketing campaigns that fuel our growth. In this role, you’ll collaborate with the Business Development and Enterprise Sales teams to support marketing campaigns to promote and celebrate our unique relationships with restaurant partners. These campaigns will accelerate acquisition, activation, and loyalty across all audiences. This role will manage data analysis and campaign reporting for marketing products. This is a truly unique opportunity to help define and shape a fast-growing, global consumer brand with the mission of “delivering good by connecting people and possibility. "What you’ll do Work closely with the ops and sales teams on execution of ad campaigns Gather data for marketing products and prepare data for subsequent analysis. Develop client-facing reports that synthesize campaign performance trends and identify optimization opportunities. Analyze performance of marketing products and surface product performance insights to support sales efforts. About you You have a passion for data with strong attention to detail You have the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional team members within the company You value efficiency and quality. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or higher 1-3 years’ experience as an analyst or marketer in an advertising agency, consumer brand or tech company You have an understanding of relational databases, ETL tools, data conversion and data cleansing methods You are proficient in excel (can maintain large, complex data sets) You have experience using SQL to aggregate and cleanse data Thrive in a self-starter, fast-paced and changing environment Strong organization and communication skills. To know more about current opportunities at LeadStack , please visit us on https://leadstackinc.com/careers/ Should you have any questions, feel free to call me on 415-985-0815 or send an email on mohd.zeeshan@leadstackinc.com

title: Supply Chain Business Analyst
description: Job Title: Business Analyst Location: Vacaville, CA 95688 (Hybrid 3 days onsite) Duration: 8 Months Pay Range: Between $50/hr-$59/hr on W2 (DOE) Summary Enables the client End to End Supply Chain and solves information problems and requirements by analyzing pharmaceutical bulk drug-substance production, quality, raw material and supply chain requirements; by designing and maintaining site SAP Master Data; and providing data analysis of supply chain-related operations. Job Responsibilities Partners with internal and external stakeholders within Materials Management/Supply Chain, Manufacturing, Technology, Quality and Finance organizations to control the production master data lifecycle in SAP; design, develop, deploy, maintain, optimize, audit, and retire. Maintains a high-level understanding of the data related business processes and systems within/ outside the ERP system landscape to ensure SAP data domain compliance. Creates, modifies, maintains, and retires SAP Master Data Objects related to production and raw material masters, Recipes, Bill of Materials, Resources, COA Profiles, Inspection Plans and Characteristics, as well as other Info Record Data and ancillary support data. Improves data structure quality and supply chain process (planning, shipping, etc.) efficiency by studying current practices and designing data structure modifications. Support enterprise-wide SAP projects; participate in site user testing; provide user requirements review and input. Proactively identifying problems and own solutions for improving written procedures, business process instructions, workflows and training materials related to the Maintain Master Data business unit. Determine operational objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formatting data sets to meet these needs. Define, monitor, and report on project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases, and elements required to implement/modify associated master data. Executes work in accordance with Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) standards, regulations, and documentation. Prepares technical reports for production and supply chain stakeholders by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing transactional information and trends. Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing professional networks; and benchmarking industry practices. Work independently on routine and non-routine production campaign-based activities; support the site Impact Projects under direction of the manager or project lead. Job Requirements Education: BA/BS degree in computer science, supply chain, business, or engineering fields, or AS with equivalent work experience (6+ years), or Direct work experience within biotech, pharmaceutical, or chemical manufacturing (10+ years). Experience (may vary depending on site size/scope) 4-6 years of GMP experience in a biotech, pharmaceutical, or chemical manufacturing environment. 3-5 years of experience in managing product/material master data within SAP. Knowledge/Skills/Competencies Experience with use of computer-based systems, in a validated environment. Prior direct SAP system (preferably R3P) use experience (ie - as end user, developing data, etc.). Able to organize large sets of electronic data in spreadsheets and databases. Possesses good problem solving, interpersonal, communication (written and verbal), team, and customer service skills. Able to partner with a variety of internal and external customers and partners, such as Supply Chain, Manufacturing, Technology, Quality and Finance departments. Exercises independent judgment and discretion to solve a variety of problems of moderate scope and complexity. Consistently model behaviors that reinforce safety in the workplace. APICS certification preferred. Knowledge and practical application of Lean and/or Six Sigma methodology preferred. Self-starter who takes personal accountability for delivering team outcomes and models high professional standards for self, and supports a speak-up/ psychologically safe work culture. Work Environment/Physical Demands/Safety Considerations Standard office environment Benefits Info: Russell Tobin offers eligible employee’s comprehensive healthcare coverage (medical, dental, and vision plans), supplemental coverage (accident insurance, critical illness insurance and hospital indemnity), a 401(k)-retirement savings, life & disability insurance, an employee assistance program, identity theft protection, legal support, auto and home insurance, pet insurance, and employee discounts with some preferred vendors.

title: Business Ops Analyst (Select locations only)
description: At U.S. Bank, we’re on a journey to do our best. Helping the customers and businesses we serve to make better and smarter financial decisions and enabling the communities we support to grow and succeed. We believe it takes all of us to bring our shared ambition to life, and each person is unique in their potential. A career with U.S. Bank gives you a wide, ever-growing range of opportunities to discover what makes you thrive at every stage of your career. Try new things, learn new skills and discover what you excel at—all from Day One. Job Description This is a back office, high-volume call center position. The Business Operations Analyst will have strong time management skills to pivot workload based on customer needs. You will be providing excellent customer service in a fast-paced customer service support role to our more than 10,000 customers surrounding express mail. Job Highlights: We partner with over 13 vendors surrounding express mail. You will help support over 10,000 desktop users through phone calls. The ideal hire will have strong time management skills. Confidence speaking to a room full of senior leaders. Able to complete a lots of spreadsheet work with Excel. Resetting passwords to users who call in with urgent needs. Self-started who's able to prioritize work and customer request independently. This role is hybrid. Team members who are in a hybrid role typically spend three days a week at the listed U.S. Bank location(s), while having flexibility on their work location for the other working days. This role is not eligible for full-time remote work. This position is currently only available at the locations below: OH-Lunken Operations Ctr -5065 Wooster Rd Cincinnati, OH MN-Energy Park 1200 Energy Park Drive MO-One US Bank Plaza -505 N 7th Street St. Louis, MO. 63101 OR-Columbia Center – 17650 NE Sandy Blvd Gresham, OR (Portland) WI-U.S. Bank Center - 777 E Wisconsin Ave La Mirada Operations Ctr CA - 1640 Valley View, La Mirada, CA Responsible for defining and performing systems analysis and development tasks to improve workflow and operating efficiency. Formulates proposals for new systems and information needs by analyzing existing systems and procedures and defining recommended technical and procedural improvements. Analyzes costs of existing operations and estimates cost savings to be achieved by implementing proposed changes; makes recommendations based on analysis. Participates in the modification of existing applications or development of new applications. Acts as a liaison and technical resource between management, staff and information systems to define and communicate standards of operational policy, plans, customer service or financial/performance reporting. Ensures all documentation and requests comply with established policies and procedures. Maintains applicable systems to monitor and track projects, plans and/or data; provides reports to management as needed. Writes test plans and performs tests of new systems and modifications to existing systems. Develops communication tools to ensure a high level of awareness of policies, plans, procedures or study/project results. Benefits: Our approach to benefits and total rewards considers our team members’ whole selves and what may be needed to thrive in and outside work. That's why our benefits are designed to help you and your family boost your health, protect your financial security and give you peace of mind. Our benefits include the following (some may vary based on role, location or hours): Healthcare (medical, dental, vision) Basic term and optional term life insurance Short-term and long-term disability Pregnancy disability and parental leave 401(k) and employer-funded retirement plan Paid vacation (from two to five weeks depending on salary grade and tenure) Up to 11 paid holiday opportunities Adoption assistance Sick and Safe Leave accruals of one hour for every 30 worked, up to 80 hours per calendar year unless otherwise provided by law EEO is the Law U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. title: Supply Chain Business Operations - Business Analyst V
description: Job Description Business Analyst V Onsite Summary: At our company, our mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. The Virtual Reality (VR) team is building products that make it easier for people to connect with the ones they love the most. We are a team of world-class experts developing and shipping products at the intersection of hardware, software, and content. As the Supply Chain Business Operations - Business Analyst V for VR Devices, you will play a crucial role in advancing our business objectives pertaining to Strategic Sourcing and Supply Chain management by consolidating and analyzing business data, solving critical business issues and providing meaningful business intelligence and insights for decision making throughout product life cycles. Responsibilities: Collaborate strategic cross-functional initiatives including multi-year transformational projects, long range planning, functional reviews and goal setting. Collaborate with internal product, engineering and analytics team and external vendors to build best in class build supply chain processes and systems Support group Functional Reviews and management of team KPI (key performance indicators) data sources/dashboard Be the focal point of contact for Strategic Sourcing managers in organizing team structure, establishing team metrics and developing common processes Build short term analytical and operational tools and reports used in Sourcing organization, find ways to scale them into medium and long term solutions Build a platform to collect and disseminate risks, opportunities, and intelligence as it relates to supply chain Create cross functional forums to discuss and bring best supply chain solutions as it relates to Strategic Sourcing title: Principal Business Analyst
description: Principal Business Analyst Oakland, CA - Hybrid onsite 1-2 days per week Role Summary This position is available with a leading ocean shipping and logistics provider. This person would be responsible for leading Business Analysis efforts for their newly formed innovation team. This individual will mentor and lead Business Analysts to gather business requirements and work on strategic innovation initiatives for their entire enterprise. The individual should be a self-starter and also have the ability to work well in a team environment across multiple departments. Additionally, they will contribute to the development of their innovation strategy, the strengthening and optimization of their innovation governance and the development and deployment of their innovative solutions. They will need to possess excellent leadership qualities, to operate a matrix management regime that allows staff to be deployed effectively to projects to work closely with colleagues, key stakeholders, and external suppliers. Responsibilities: Lead requirements gathering for the Strategic Innovation group. Quickly adopt to industry trends and developments and apply that knowledge to improve our services to customers and carriers. Apply the knowledge to understand business problems and provide effective solutions. Recruit and mentor junior Business Analysts. Coordinate with multiple teams on project requirements. Respond to and resolve business inquiries and concerns. Report customer issues to operational groups within our team and provide follow-up to ensure a satisfactory resolution. Develop an understanding of the customer's business, build relationships, and identify opportunities for growth in all services they have available. Desired Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities: Excellent communication skills, with the ability to interact with staff at all levels of the Company, recognizing the demands of the environment and the specific challenges that these present. Ability to build and maintain strong rapport and trust with customers, peers, and leadership. High-level presentation skills, experience in developing documentation, training materials, and conducting training sessions. Ability to work with others across the organization. Building strong relationships with business units and delivers solutions. Ability to effectively communicate in a variety of settings including one-on-one, small, and large groups. Demonstrate creative and innovative thinking and encourage teams to bring their ideas. Experience of business analysis (and enterprise architecture or project management would also be highly desirable) delivering a range of applications. Ability to learn their businesses, services, and competitive strategies. Strong organizational skills and ability to manage global teams and work in a team environment. Strong analytical, critical, and strategic thinking skills. Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Demonstratable decision-making skills. Ability to deal with conflicts and strong negotiation skills. Strong problem-solving skills. Requirements: 7+ years of experience in Business Analysis/Analytics Experience in the Logistics, Shipping, Transportation and/or Supply Chain environment is preferred Proficiency with SQL Experience using Tableau or Power BI Nice to have: Familiarity with at least one of the following areas: ocean transportation, terminals management or asset lite/assetless intermodal, or trucking services
